title: Creative Project Manager
description:
📍Stockholm or Madrid
 



 📆 As soon as possible
 



 👩🏽‍💻 Office: 3 Days a Week
 



 📚 Our Recruitment Process
 



 At Precis, we are a group of friendly experts in media buying, analytics & marketing science, creative and technology with a joint mission to help great companies thrive in the digital landscape.
 



 Are you curious to learn more about us? Read more about us here. For insights into what life is like at Precis and a peek at the perks of working with us, visit this page. In our Handbook, you can get a neat summary of who we are, our culture and our offices.
   





*We are committed to building an inclusive and fair workplace that attracts talent and advances its people, regardless of their background, experiences or perspectives. We believe that a diverse set of minds will continue to contribute to our innovative culture and our ability to reinvent ourselves constantly.*




**WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING** 
  
 



 Your primary responsibility is to independently manage project lifecycles, from scoping to delivery. You will prioritize tasks to ensure efficient project execution, directly contributing to client satisfaction and overall project success. This role requires effective time management, problem-solving, and proactive communication to address challenges and deliver high-quality outcomes. Your contributions are key to maintaining our reputation for excellence and driving the company forward.
   




* Manage & develop detailed project lifecycles from initial scoping to delivery, ensuring projects are executed effectively with minimal supervision.
* Employ project management tools and practices to streamline processes, monitor progress, manage risks, and ensure timely completion.
* Serve as a point of contact for clients, managing expectations and providing regular updates.
* Effectively leverage internal quality control processes, ensuring that deliverables exceed established standards.
* Provide actionable feedback to team members, contributing to continuous improvement.



**WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR** 
  
   




* Proficiency in project management methodologies and tools, as well as digital marketing formats and placements.
* Ability to build and maintain client relationships, manage expectations, and ensure satisfaction.
* Commitment to learning and applying new skills, tools, and methodologies to enhance project outcomes and professional growth.
* Strong ability to communicate clearly and effectively in English with team members and clients.
* Proficiency in ensuring tasks and deliverables meet quality standards and align with project objectives.
* Strong ability to identify issues early, propose solutions, and implement changes that ensure project success.
* Strong team player with the ability to work well with others to achieve common goals and objectives.
* Effective at prioritizing tasks and managing time to meet deadlines and project milestones.
* Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changing circumstances and embrace new tools and processes.
* Proficiency in tools such as Microsoft360, mainly Excel and Word, Google Suite, mainly Sheets and Docs).
* Experience working in Figma, Adlayer or similar software is a plus



**WHAT WE OFFER**
*You can read our full offering in our* 
*handbook.* 



* An intense learning environment where you will be able to grow and develop your skills and passions alongside some of the brightest minds in the industry.
* A culture that is built on collaboration, trust and innovation. We value having fun together - that’s why we also have regular afterworks, team events and a yearly festival.
* Transparent salary setting, you can find all our salary bands in our handbook. This role is an
 **L2** 
*role within the
 **Creative Craft** 
  column* 
 . Check it out!
* 30 days paid leave, flexible public holidays, parental pay, a solid pension scheme and key insurance. Our different offices also offer different perks such as massage, health care contributions, free book orders, healthy snacks & great coffee, EAP programs and your choice of PC or Mac.
* A diverse environment with a high focus on inclusion and belonging. We speak over 27 native languages around Precis, and our internal inclusion score is 4.5 out of 5.


**Please send your application in ENGLISH** 
**We update all candidates on their application by email. If you don't receive an email from us, please check your spam folder.**

title: UX Writer
description:
**About Us**
 Soundtrack is a B2B scale-up company providing music streaming services for businesses. We serve small customers like the café around the corner, and much bigger brands like Joe & the Juice, Toni & Guy and TAG Heuer. On the inside, we're a bunch of talented, motivated and humble designers, engineers and music experts. We believe in product-led growth, where the product is the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion and expansion.
   

  

**The Role**
 We're looking for a UX Writer for the Product Experience (PX) team at Soundtrack. As a UX Writer, you’ll be responsible for the language inside our product – from what appears on buttons and error messages to the small guiding texts that help users navigate different flows. You're a key part of shaping our product language and ensuring clarity, consistency, and a smooth user experience across all touchpoints.
   

  

 In this role you’ll set the foundation for our product copy across all platforms – building a glossary, tone of voice, and style guide – while also driving microcopy in the product’s flows. You’ll work closely with product managers, designers, and developers, making sure copy is considered early in the design process and supports both conversion and usability.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Define and maintain glossary, tone of voice and style guide for product copy
* Improve existing product copy across web and app, and ensure consistency
* Write clear and concise microcopy for buttons, messages, tooltips and flows
* Collaborate in Figma and product prototypes together with designers and developers
* Ensure copy works across languages and is easy to translate
* Support testing and data-driven improvements of product copy


**About You**
 Just like us, you love music. You're collaborative and open, and you know how to balance working independently with being a strong team player. In this role, you’ll need to be confident in driving processes, bringing others along, and not afraid to present and stand by your ideas. We value people who are clear in their communication, humble in their approach, and curious to learn — while always keeping the user experience at the center.
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience in UX writing, content design or similar product-focused roles
* Strong portfolio with examples of impactful microcopy in digital products
* Experience working end-to-end in product development, from idea to launch
* Excellent written and verbal English (native level a strong plus)
* Familiarity with Figma and working in cross-functional teams
* Understanding of usability, accessibility and plain language principles


**Beneficial Requirements**
* Experience with A/B testing or user testing of product copy
* Previous experience in scale-up or fast-paced environments
* Previous experience in product design-roles


**Employee Benefits**
* We offer a flexible workplace with the possibility to work remotely
* Generous pension plan
* Yearly budget for health, wellness and personal development
* Laptop and mobile phone of your choice with included cellular subscription
* Regular social activities such as team events, meet ups, after works and off-sites
* Daily breakfast served at the office


 At Soundtrack, we believe that diversity fuels creativity and innovation. We're committed to building a team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences. We welcome applications from individuals of all races, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, religions, sexual orientations, and identities.
   

  

 We reserve the right to close this vacancy early if we identify a suitable candidate early in the process. To ensure consideration, we encourage you to submit your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 Please note that we only accept applications submitted via our career page and do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Arfve Accelerator 2025 – Calling Talented Graphic Designers to Shape the Future of Tech
description:
**Are you ready to design the future of consumer tech?** 




 Arfve Accelerator 2025 is looking for 
 **graphic designers and visual creators** 
  to join our journey in building a new era of modular, intelligent devices – starting with earbuds, headphones, and wearables.
 



 This is your chance to help shape how a movement looks and feels – from brand identity to packaging design, from pitch decks to digital assets that will be seen globally.
 



  





 At Arfve, our core positioning is simple yet ambitious:
 




 Modular Intelligence. Human Potential.
 





 We believe design is a key part of making technology human again – intelligent systems that adapt to us, grow with us, and last
   





**About the Program** 
* **Duration:** 
  12–20 weeks (immediate start preferred)
* **Type:** 
  Initially unpaid internship, strong potential for paid roles
* **Format:** 
  Fully remote, flexible hours
* **Who:** 
  Students, recent graduates, or early-career graphic designers with passion for branding, digital design, and creative storytelling.


**Role – Graphic Design Intern** 

 You’ll work on a broad range of design challenges, including:
 


* Updating and refining the 
 **Arfve brand book** 
  and visual identity.
* Designing 
 **packaging concepts** 
  for modular tech devices.
* Creating 
 **presentations, pitch decks, and crowdfunding materials** 
 .
* Designing 
 **social media visuals** 
  and graphical elements for campaigns.
* Collaborating with engineers and marketers to align design with product storytelling.


**Required & Advantageous Skills** 

**Required:** 



* Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign) or Figma.
* A sharp eye for typography, layout, and modern graphic trends.
* Ability to adapt design across formats (print, digital, presentations).



**Advantageous:** 



* Motion graphics and animation (After Effects, Blender, or similar).
* Experience in packaging or product-related design.
* Familiarity with crowdfunding campaigns or social media branding.


**Why Join Us?** 
* Build a portfolio with 
 **global visibility** 
  through crowdfunding and partnerships.
* Work closely with a 
 **multidisciplinary team** 
  of designers, engineers, and marketers.
* Gain real-world experience shaping the identity of a 
 **future-forward tech company** 
 .
* Be part of a movement: design that amplifies 
 **human potential** 
  through modular intelligence.


**How to Apply** 

 Apply via LinkedIn Easy Apply and send an email to 
 **team@arfve.com** 




  with:
 


* A short note on why this role excites you.
* Your resume.
* A portfolio link (Behance, Dribbble, website, or PDF).



**Start:** 
  Immediate preferred
 



**Format:** 
  Remote & flexible with weekly check-ins
 



**Let’s design the future together – join Arfve Accelerator 2025 and help us make technology human again.** 




  





 #ModularIntelligence#HumanPotential#Arfve#DesignThatLasts#FutureByDesign#IntelligentDesign

title: Senior Product Designer
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We’re hiring
 **Senior Product Designers at Wolt** 
 across several exciting product areas:
   

  

* Consumer – You'll shape the core experience that millions of users rely on daily to discover, order, and enjoy their favorite meals and essentials—delivering delight at every tap.
* Merchant – You’ll build tools that help local businesses succeed on the Wolt platform, from order management to insights and growth levers—empowering merchants at scale.
* Courier – You’ll design experiences for the people who make Wolt run—our courier partners. From onboarding to daily logistics, your work will help make every delivery seamless.
* Central – You’ll create the systems, platforms, and tools that power Wolt behind the scenes—unlocking scale, speed, and smarter decisions across the company.


 Each team offers a chance to tackle unique design challenges with real-world impact.
   

  

 📍The roles are based in our tech hubs in Berlin, Helsinki and Stockholm.
   

  

 You’re excited about this opportunity because:
   

  

* You care deeply about creating experiences that empower businesses and improve everyday life for merchants, couriers, and consumers.
* You lead with empathy, always designing with the user in mind.
* You thrive in complex, ambiguous problem spaces—and enjoy bringing structure, clarity, and direction.
* You hold a high bar for your craft, from concept to pixel—creating designs that are scalable, thoughtful, and beautiful.


 What you’ll be doing:
   

  

* Turn ambiguity into clarity. You’ll bring strong framing and product thinking to shape undefined problems into compelling design opportunities.
* Bring ideas to life beautifully. You’ll design intuitive interfaces and interactions that are both delightful and highly usable.
* Prototype to inspire. Through prototyping, storytelling, and systems thinking, you’ll align teams and build momentum—ensuring your work not only ships, but resonates.
* Own the full design stack. From strategy and exploration to refined visuals, you’ll lead high-impact initiatives from start to finish.


 Who you are:
   

  

 We’d love to work with you if:
   

  

* You have 6+ years of experience designing consumer, B2B, or SaaS products—building elegant, business-savvy solutions in complex environments.
* You’re a T-shaped designer with deep strengths in concepting, visual design and prototyping, able to drive high-quality outcomes in a collaborative, cross-functional team.
* You think in systems, not just screens—comfortable designing across diverse journeys and touchpoints.
* You’re a creative problem-solver, excited by ambiguity and energized by complex design challenges.
* You’re open to feedback—comfortable sharing early, learning fast, and evolving ideas with your team.
* You’re a strong communicator and natural storyteller, able to align stakeholders, build empathy, and drive design-led decisions.


 What’s next:
   

  

 As a next step, we’d love to see your
 **portfolio** 
 to better understand your design approach and impact. We’re especially interested in work that shows
 **strong visual craft** 
 ,
 **attention to detail** 
 , and
 **real results** 
 . One well-structured Figma file with your best, recent work is more valuable to us than multiple outdated case studies — products move fast, and relevance matters. If you have
 **high-fidelity prototypes** 
 or
 **motion work** 
 , even better. We're excited to see how you think and build.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Game Engineer UI/UX
description:
At Embark, we want to empower everyone to create games!
   

  

 You will be working on our live service game THE FINALS, a first-person shooter, alongside some of the most talented people in the games industry.
   

  

 As a Game Engineer UI/UX you will have a creative role, working together with designers, other engineers, artists, and user experience (UX) researchers to improve and develop new features for our game. Here you will have the opportunity to take responsibility for our game’s user interface and player experience.
   

  

 We are looking for someone who will help improve our UI framework and components with a special focus on performance, tooling and scalability.
   

  

 The game we’re making is built in Unreal, using C++, blueprints and a scripting language called Angelscript.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Implement C++ UI core technology in Unreal (e.g. Slate)
* Implement UI features in Unreal Engine using a mix of C++, Angelscript and Unreal Blueprints
* Collaborate with a wide range of talents at Embark to deliver a great user experience, better tools and a performant and top of the line UI


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind
* 5+ years of experience working within the game industry
* A strong background in C++
* Knowledge of using Unreal Engine with Slate/UMG
* An interest in computer science and programming as a craft
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Product Lead, Support AI
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for an experienced
 **Product Lead** 
 to join the
 **Support AI Team** 
 within the Support Product Group. This is a brand-new team that will define and build AI-powered products from the ground up. The Support Group consists of 5 different teams building products and tools that power Wolt’s customer support.
   

  

 Delightful customer experience is one of the cornerstones of Wolt, and we see Wolt’s high-quality support as an important part of the overall customer experience. Over the years, we have invested a lot in our in-house built support tooling and products, as we believe it’s the best way for us to provide a world-class support experience and ensure satisfaction for our consumers, courier partners, and merchants across the 30 countries we operate in.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll be leading Wolt’s strategic efforts in bringing
 **AI and LLM-based solutions** 
 into the support domain. As Product Lead, you will own the vision and roadmap for our Support AI team and play a key role in shaping Wolt’s first wave of AI-driven support products. This includes building intelligent systems that help support agents quickly identify issues and recommend the best resolution, as well as enhancing consumer-facing support experiences through AI-powered self-service.
   

  

 You’ll be working with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, designers, and data experts in a high-visibility role. Together, you’ll drive the entire product lifecycle from identifying opportunities and experimenting with LLM-based workflows to launching scalable solutions that improve efficiency and delight users. You’ll also partner closely with business and operations stakeholders, while building an in-depth understanding of Wolt’s support operations and our end users -consumers, merchants, courier partners, and our internal support teams-.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Proven experience as a Product Lead / Product Manager, preferably in growth, marketplace, or decision making domains, you know what it takes to develop great products with a strong track record of building high-growth products ,
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and have proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders/executives.
* Desire to be in a high-ownership, high-visibility role. You need to be comfortable with both driving the strategic vision for the domain but also getting hands-on and diving into the details.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding and business savvy with the go-getter attitude of a "could-be start-up CEO"
* Expertise in how to work with and lead cross-functional teams, at least with developers, design, data experts and with engineering teams


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Visual Design Lead
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us— and let the world feel your work.** 




  





**The role** 




 As a Visual Design Lead at Epidemic Sound, you'll be at the forefront of shaping the
 **visual design and user interface** 
 of our digital products. You'll lead the
 **visual design direction** 
 , defining our
 **design system** 
 ,
 **motion language** 
 , and elevating the user experience across our platforms. This is a role for a
 **hands-on visual designer** 
 who is passionate about the interplay of
 **UI** 
 , content, and motion to create a seamless and impactful experience for our users
 



 You'll report to VP Design and join our Experience Design team, a talented group of designers with a passion for creating the world’s best soundtracking platform for creators. You will collaborate closely with other designers, engineers, product managers, and brand and marketing teams, to ensure a cohesive and impactful end-to-end user journey.
 



  





**Your key responsibilities include:** 



* Elevate the visual quality of our product by delivering compelling UI design solutions, integrating layout, typography, and motion to enhance user engagemen
* Translate complex concepts into intuitive, cohesive, and high-impact user interfaces, using motion, interaction and visual design to guide attention and improve usability.
* Lead the development of visual and motion systems to ensure consistency, scalability, and a refined user experience across platforms.
* Mentor and support designers across teams, fostering excellence in visual, interaction, and motion design craft.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, tech, brand and marketing teams to influence and shape the end-to-end experience with a strong point of view on how it should look, feel, and move.



  





**Requirements** 



* A strong portfolio of innovative and emotionally resonant work, demonstrating your leadership in shaping acclaimed digital products and brand experiences.
* Proven expertise in translating high-level strategy into compelling art direction, and a track record of developing scalable visual and motion design systems.
* In-house, cross-functional experience—proven collaboration with engineering, product, and brand partners.
* Mastery of the modern design toolset, with a particular fluency for prototyping, visual, and motion design.



  





**Soft Requirements** 



* A true collaborator and natural influencer, with a gift for building consensus and inspiring designer peers, teams and stakeholders around a shared creative vision.
* Exceptional storytelling and communication skills, able to articulate the 'why' behind your design decisions to everyone from junior designers to executive leaders.
* A deep-seated passion for mentoring, with a genuine desire to elevate the craft, creativity, and confidence of the designers you work with.
* A balance of strong creative conviction and an empathetic, humble approach, welcoming diverse perspectives to strengthen your design solutions.



  





**Equal opportunity employer** 




 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
 



  





**Application** 




 Ready to make the world
 *feel* 
 your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link below.
 



  





***Thinking about joining us? Tune in here - and see if we sound like your kind of vibe.***

title: AI-Assisted Product Engineer (part-time)
description:
**This is a part‑time role designed to be easily combined with studies or other commitments.** 




  





 The home renovation sector is one of the largest in Sweden - yet also one of the last to fully benefit from the power of great technology. At Dryft, we have built Sweden’s most appreciated home renovation brand while developing our own tech platform, Dryft Core. It is the engine behind both the great customer experience and the operational efficiency that the industry has never seen before.
 



  





 Now, we’re looking for you who wants to shape the future of tech in our industry by combining business development skills, problemsolving ability and the possibilities unlocked by AI.
 



  





  





**What you will do at Dryft** 




 You will rapidly build (with AI code generation tools like Claude, Cursor, or Lovable) functional prototypes of both internal tools and customer facing solutions that solve real problems for our business. This isn't about writing perfect production code - it's about moving fast, understanding what users actually need, and turning ideas into working prototypes/products.
 



  





 You have significant freedom to shape what you build. The most important skills for this role are product intuition and the ability to think critically about what makes software genuinely useful, combined with enough technical capability to bring those ideas to life using modern AI-assisted development tools.
 



 In short, you are a business‑driven problem solver who can prototype and build at the intersection of business development and tech - a role made possible thanks to AI.
 



  





  





**What we are looking for** 




  





**Product sense & user understanding** 



* You genuinely care about how people use software and what makes tools intuitive vs clunky
* You can identify which features matter and which don't
* You think about what drives business value; which features are worth building now vs later, and what will have real organizational impact
* You are comfortable making product decisions independently, not just following instructions
* You understand that the goal is to build something people actually want to use



  
 



**Technical capability** 



* You are comfortable with programming fundamentals - ideally a few university courses in computer science or equivalent experience
* You don't need to be an expert in any specific framework, but you need to understand when code looks wrong or illogical
* You can think logically about technical problems and debug issues that AI tools create
* You understand what's possible and what isn't



  





  
 



**Working style** 



* Self-directed with strong intrinsic motivation
* Comfortable with high autonomy and flexible structure
* Interested in the business side - not just the technical implementation
* You enjoy rapid iteration and learning by building



  





  





**Who we think this role is for** 




 Students or recent graduates in engineering, computer science, or related technical fields. An interest in business, product development and user experience is just as important as technical skills. If you like building things that solve real problems and have enough programming knowledge to work effectively with AI development tools, you'll likely thrive in this role.
 



  





**﻿Practical details** 




 This role combines perfectly with studies or other parallel commitments, while offering significant learning opportunities and real product ownership.
 



  




* **Time commitment:** 
 ~50% (highly flexible week‑to‑week; can vary from 0–100% depending on your schedule)
* **Location:** 
 Flexible - remote-friendly with the option to work from our office in Solna, Stockholm. Independent work can be done from anywhere, but collaboration with business teams often happens face-to-face at the office.
* **Schedule:** 
 Set your own hours
* **Collaboration and team:** 
 You report to Dryft's CTO and work closely with both the tech team and business units

title: Director of Innovation & Technology
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Are you our new Director of Innovation & Technology at Getinge Critical Care in Solna? At Critical Care we develop tomorrow’s intensive care products and equipment, and we are in an intensive period of change and expansion. In this role you will be a key player within our R&D organization and have the possibility to take an active part in shaping our future products. The Innovation & Technology team has deep knowledge in our products, legacy and work together with external partners like hospitals and tech-companys to create the solutions for tomorrow always keeping the customer need in focus.
   

  

 The position offers you a great opportunity to be part of the R&D management team and influence how we prioritize and drive our Innovation, Product Development and Sustaining.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 In this position you will be responsible for securing that we have the right setup to drive innovation with deep technical expertise, rapid prototyping, usability and concept development. Today, the team consists of about 12 highly experienced engineers with a broad expertise in the technology and clinical applications of Ventilation, Anaesthesia, Data Analysis, Simulation, prototyping with mechatronics etc. The R&D organization within Critical Care currently consists of 250 dedicated employees in Sweden and Germany.
   

  

 The position gives you the opportunity to join a winning team, helping to continue the growth of our market leading and life saving products. You will interface with a wide variety of stakeholders on all levels.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities And Tasks Will Be**
* As a member of the R&D management team, participate in the portfolio discussions and drive the Innovation funnel
* Implement continuous improvement through new ways of working, and when needed apply Change Management
* Drive partnerships with Universities, Hospitals, Tech-partners and relevant Institutes world-wide
* Develop team competences and drive the strategy of Innovation forward to secure Getinge’s future competitiveness
* Daring to dream and feel comfortable being Visionary, but keep your feet on the ground


 The position is based at our site in Solna but offers the flexibility to work from home when suitable, though not more than 1-2 days per week. The role requires occasional international travel. You will be reporting to the Head of R&D in Critical Care.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To fit in this role, we believe that you have the following experience:
   

  

* PhD or MSc within Engineering or relevant field
* Excellent leadership skills, and experience from leading a cross-functional team for integrated technology development
* Experience from Concept development with rapid prototyping, speed design reviews, customer workflows and UX validation
* Experience from leading a team where you are more the facilitator than the expert, they are the experts
* Experience from implementation of TRL (Technology Readiness Levels) will be useful
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* Experience of working in a regulated industry and especially development of medical device
* A proven track-record of cross-company collaboration aligning expectations and stake holder management


 To succeed in this position, you need to be a strong and business oriented leader who is able to self drive, inspire others and set direction, priorities and goals. To work with Critical Care products means to work in a complex and fast changing environment, hence you are a change driver who creates results by successful implementation of new ways of working in a fast-paced environment. We believe that you are inspired by leading and motivating others, making continuous improvements and that you see this as an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our product development. Additionally, communication, influencing and stakeholder management skills are highly important.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible. We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 For this position we will conduct a background check on the final candidate.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Magnus Tunklev at magnus.tunklev@getinge.com or Recruiter Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

title: Senior Product Manager - Subscriptions
description:
The Conversion Product Area is responsible for the entire user journey on Spotify and ensures we engage with people in innovative ways, every step of the way. Delighting our users while fairly compensating artists and creators is at the core of Spotify’s mission. Our team grows Spotify’s audience by finding future listeners around the world and delivering the right value to them, at the right time. With research, product management, product design, engineering, and marketing all collaborating in one organization, we’re able to quickly build meaningful features and services for millions of people, resulting in joyful, long-lasting relationships with Spotify.
   

  

 We have bold plans in the Activation, Retention and Conversion team to build the next generation multi dimensional merchandising platform, and we are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join the team. You will be working on the Merchandising Platform, including both new and emerging revenue streams. You will play a key part in helping to shape the way we reason through our product offering, how we build the right building blocks and platform capabilities to have a substantial impact on one of the world’s largest subscription based platforms.
   

  

 What You'll Do
   

  

* Own product vision, product goals, product strategy, roadmaps for scalable, dynamic systems for merchandising subscriptions business
* Promote platform thinking by collaborating with Product Managers to create cohesive, scalable, and extensible solutions aligned with Spotify’s long-term vision.
* Work closely with stakeholders and a skilled team of cross-functional peers to define a roadmap that balances developing our Merchandising Platform strategy, meeting current business needs, managing technical debt, and unlocking new opportunities.
* Collaborate with engineering, design, insights and product, within your team and business stakeholders across the organisation to set goals and develop strategies for reaching them
* Contribute a genuine passion and enthusiasm for your products and mission, and for solving your user’s needs.
* Demonstrate and help instil platform thinking and practices across our development teams.


 Who You Are
   

  

* You are a platform PM with experience of shipping internal platforms at consumer scale.
* A proven operator with a track record of formulating product vision, defining and implementing product strategy to launch internal platform systems
* Collaborative and able to thrive in cross-functional teams.
* Inspirational with an ability to empower and support a team to get things done.
* You have demonstrable experience developing and managing world-class software products
* You’re experienced in making hard data-informed decisions (A/B experimentation, user testing, data analysis, competitors and market analysis, defining metrics)
* Experience in crafting clear product requirements based on research, data and insights.
* An expert with APIs, data pipelines or very familiar with technical roles.


 Where You'll Be
   

  

* This role is based in London
* We offer you the flexibility to work where you work best! There will be some in person meetings, but still allows for flexibility to work from home.


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Product Lead, Payments
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the Payments Group, Core Payments Team.
   

  

 The Payments group builds and scales the infrastructure that powers every transaction on Wolt. This includes integrating with global payment providers, ensuring reliable and cost-efficient processing across countries, and driving innovations like digital wallets, installment payments, and localized methods. The Core Payments Team owns the foundations of this stack, making sure that Wolt’s payments platform is secure, scalable, and ready for the future.
   

  

 The Product Lead for the Core Payments Team connects with country teams to understand payment cultures in local markets, facilitates business and technical discussions with providers like Stripe, and aligns with product, finance, and data teams on company-wide needs.
   

  

 As a Product Lead, you will work with a cross-functional team of incredibly talented engineers, analysts, and product peers in a high visibility role. You will be responsible for defining the roadmap and setting the vision for our payments infrastructure. This involves leading multiple projects and cross-team product initiatives across the entire product lifecycle—partnering with operations, finance, and engineering stakeholders, while always keeping the end-user and business impact in focus.
   

  

 📍This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Berlin, or Stockholm
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* Proven experience as a Product Lead in fintech, payments, or other B2B platform products. You know how to build robust, scalable financial systems.
* Track record of leading products from concept to launch—owning the vision, setting the strategy, shaping the roadmap, and delivering real results.
* Skilled at working with cross-functional teams across product, engineering, data, and business—keeping people aligned and momentum strong.
* High ownership mindset. Comfortable getting hands-on when needed, while also pushing complex initiatives beyond your immediate scope.
* Strong blend of data fluency, technical depth, design intuition, and business judgment—grounded in a humble, entrepreneurial mindset.
* Confident in high-visibility roles. Clear communicator who knows how to keep stakeholders aligned, even in messy or high-pressure situations


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: iOS Engineer, Merchant Group
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

**About Merchant Group**
 Merchant Group comprises Merchant Core, Growth, Operations Management, New Business sub-groups containing 25+ teams . These are cross-functional teams built with different skill sets, and we expect product engineers to collaborate with Data, Design and Product, ensuring we’re fulfilling our Merchants' needs.
   

  

 Merchant products make Wolt an integral part of our Merchants' daily lives. We build tools and automation that are useful, efficient, reliable, and delightful to use. Our products are built around self-service, which helps us keep trust at the core of our partner relationships. If that's something that gets you excited, don't hesitate to drop in your application.
   

  

 What you’ll be doing
   

  

 As an
 **iOS Engineer in Wolt’s Merchant Group** 
 , you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of the merchant experience. We are building a brand-new, business-critical product that will empower hundreds of thousands of restaurants, supermarkets, and retailers to serve millions of customers worldwide - and you’ll have the opportunity to influence it from its very first line of code.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll design, implement, and refine the tools that merchants use every day - whether it’s managing menus and orders, tracking performance, or scaling their business. You’ll work closely with designers, analysts, product leads, and fellow engineers to ensure the app is intuitive, reliable, and scalable as our merchant base rapidly grows.
   

  

 This is a chance to
 **build from scratch** 
 with modern best practices, collaborate with some of the best engineers in the industry. At Wolt, we value autonomy, ownership, and technical excellence. You’ll have the freedom to shape both
 **what** 
 we build and
 **how** 
 we build it - while receiving mentorship, support, and opportunities to grow every step of the way.
   

  

 Our humble expectations
   

  

* Working with senior developers in architecting and building key components of modern iOS applications, leveraging both existing technology assets and new tools such as modern Swift, general concurrency principles and Swift native concurrency, unit testing, familiarity with design patterns, Xcode, experience with UIKit.
* Influence architecture decisions and technology stack selection, and help steer overall product direction.
* Collaborate closely with product, design, and backend teams to shape features and user experiences.
* Implement high-quality, scalable code while maintaining performance and security standards.
* Rapidly iterate and adapt to evolving requirements and ambiguous contexts.
* Continuously refine the app’s user experience to support and enhance merchants’ daily operations.
* Drive innovation and help to establish best practices for the team.


 Next steps
   

  

 We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, and the role will be filled as soon as we find the right person - so don’t wait!
   

  

 The hiring process typically includes a conversation with the Talent Acquisition Partner, followed by technical interviews, a team chat, and a final decision.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Examensarbete - Strategic CX Benchmarking with External Organizations
description:
**Location:** 
 Stockholm or Oxelösund
   

  

**Country:** 
 Sweden
   

  

**Application due date:** 
 11/2/2025 23:59:59 UTC
   

  

 Our customer’s business has always been a key priority within the Special Steels Division of SSAB (c. 4100 out of 14500 employees), and we have decided to sharpen our focus on customer experience even further. We are a global B2B market-leader with a wide range of customers around the world. Our main sites are the steel mills in Oxelösund and Mobile, Alabama – but we also have 90+ global sites. While striving forward with our strategic work in customer experience, we have seen a need for further exploration outside of our own company. Both within our own field and other widely different industries.
   

  

 Becoming part of the SSAB family means joining a journey. A journey that we believe is essential for the sustainability of this planet. Steel has been one of the most important materials for developing our society and it will continue to be so. In the roofs over our heads, in the bridges connecting our cities and in the cars of tomorrow. At SSAB we are proud of our history and leadership in high-strength steel. But we are also aware that the production of steel is one of the largest emitters of greenhouse gases in the world. That has to change. That is why we have developed the world’s ﬁrst fossil free steel production and has committed to becoming largely fossil-free. As part of SSAB you will be instrumental in realizing this goal and push for the green transformation of the whole steel industry.
   

  

**About The Thesis Project**
 Your work during the Spring of 2026 (c. 20 weeks, 30 ECTS) will mainly revolve around understanding external organizations’ work with strategic customer experience, while understanding how this may differ from our internal approach. Ultimately, you will provide us with concrete recommendations and inspiration for how we could develop our strategic CX work going forward. The details and delimitations of the thesis plan will be decided together with you at a later date, but you are expected to perform extensive interviews with external organizations.
   

  

 Apply with your CV and a short personal letter (a portfolio is not required). If you choose to be based at our Stockholm Office (World Trade Center), there will be some possibility for remote-based work. We will also visit our Oxelösund site and have a tour of the steel mill.
   

  

**Following stept are suggested**
* The details and delimitations of the thesis plan will be decided together with you and your university supervisor.
* Apart from other sources and our internal ways of working, there will be a need for extensive interviews with external organizations. You will have strong support internally.
* Analysis based on the data and compiled knowledge.
* Summarize concrete recommendations and inspiration for the future of Special Steels strategic CX work.
* Final presentation for relevant stakeholders.


**About**
**About You**
* You are currently studying for a one or two-year Master’s Degree in Sweden, with a relevant background and/or field of specialization (for example, CX, Service Design, User Experience, Business Development or Innovation).
* We are looking for someone with a genuine interest in Customer Experience (both on an operative and strategic level).
* You are self-going, pragmatic and get things done.
* Excellent listening, communication and collaboration skills.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


**Our offer**
 At SSAB we strive for a diverse and inclusive environment. We use our values – driven, true and ahead – in making everyday decisions, keeping the customer at the heart of what we do. This makes us all team players, each with the drive to improve. When joining SSAB you will become part of an organization of passionate problem solvers working together on important challenges. We will support your growth by providing a safe and friendly workplace that contributes to work-life balance. If you set out to achieve it, at SSAB you will have the possibility of broadening your skills and grow within your field or beyond.
   

  

 SSAB pays compensation for approved thesis.
   

  

**Recruitment process**
 1. Apply
   

  

 2. Interview
   

  

 3. Come and meet us
   

  

 4. Health Examination
   

  

 5. Sign
   

  

 Background check may be a part of the recruitment process.
   

  

**Got questions about this position?**
 Please contact Carl Ryttmarker, Strategy & Planning, Customer Experience
   

  

 Contact Carl via mail - carl.ryttmarker@ssab.com
   

  

 We decline contacts from recruitment agencies and ad sellers regarding this advertisement.
   

  

 Trade union information is provided by Akademikerföreningen, Unionen and Ledarna, which can be reached via our switchboard on phone +46 155 254 000.
   

  

**Some words from your supervisors**
 "Looking for an exciting Spring 2026? Then you should definitely apply to join our Strategy & Planning function to support us with our CX work. My name is Carl Ryttmarker and I am responsible for Customer Experience at Special Steels, and I will be your thesis supervisor. There is a lot ongoing within CX in our company, and we need your operative support in our continuous development and external understanding. Looking forward to your application!"
   

  

 Carl Ryttmarker, Strategy & Planning, Customer Experience
   

  

**Join us at SSAB**

title: Frontend Deveoper
description:
Do you want to help us unleash the secret to how happy employees create a happy business? We are an innovative, agile, and continuously growing modern tech company on a path to improving the work lives of millions around the world.
   

  

**We develop workforce management solutions** 
 - software that makes scheduling and time reporting more smooth and more flexible for almost a million users worldwide!
   

  

****We value passion, quality, innovation, trust, and collaboration** 
 .** 
 You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas, and have full ownership of your area.
   

  

 Are you curious and ready to take the first steps on an awesome journey and make magic happen with us? As a member of Quinyx, you will be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone is allowed to be themselves and thrive.
   

  

*We have a hybrid working set up and therefore you will be required to attend our Stockholm office minimum twice per week.*
**About The Role**
 We are building one of the most successful AI-Driven Workforce Management solutions that empowers the growth of service industry businesses and their workforce.
   

  

 As a Frontend Engineer, you will join one of our strong cross-functional agile teams in the Manage Area. You will be working with other frontend & backend developers, QA engineers, product managers, and designers.
   

  

 We recently moved our projects into a monorepo powered by TurboRepo that includes a UI library, shared utils, types, base configurations and much more. The UI library is powered by amazing tools such as Chromatic and corresponding Github Actions, and also Changeset for streamlining versioning and documentation. We have a lot of interesting new projects on the horizon that will be built inside this repo and consume components from the UI library, so any experience with these subjects are a big plus.
   

  

 Our Engineering Team is always striving to use modern technologies, keeping ourselves updated on the news in the engineering community, and aiming to be early adopters of new stable releases. Everyone on the team deeply cares about the overall experience of our application and has a lot of fun while building solutions together.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Being part of the SaaS B2B product development team, bringing new ideas and designing solutions from beginning to end.
* Working in constantly modernising tech stack, based on React, Typescript, Jest, Storybook, React-Query, scss-modules, with a continuous delivery system
* Developing one of the core Quinyx products, adding new features, and optimising client-side performance.
* Being part of a culture where we promote learning and growth with code reviews, pair programming, conferences, and workshops where we deep-dive into certain areas of frontend web development as a team to have fun, learn, share knowledge, and experiment together.


**What You’ll Bring To The Team**
* Strong programming skills in React and TypeScript.
* 5+ years of work experience in a relevant role.
* Proficiency in modern software development practices, including version control and agile development methodologies.
* Ability to mentor and help more junior developers within the team.
* A natural curiosity and desire to improve processes around you.
* A genuine interest in front-end development and best practices.


**What We Are Looking For**
**Reasoning ability.** 
 Given the necessary knowledge, you can solve complex problems. You think from first principles, and structure your ideas sharply. You resist the influence of biases. You identify and take care of the details that matter.
   

  

**Drive** 
 . You’re extremely ambitious in everything you do—and your initiative, effort, and tenacity match the intensity of your ambition. You feel deeply responsible for your work. You hold yourself to a high—and rising—bar.
   

  

**Team spirit.** 
 You give generously and without the expectation of receiving in return. You support the best idea, not your idea. You're always happy to get your hands dirty to help your team. You’re reliable, honest, and transparent.
   

  

**Proficiency in English.** 
 You read, write, and speak proficiently in English.
   

  

**What is it for you?**
 We promote and encourage a healthy lifestyle with flexible work hours and latest tools, enhanced vacation allowance, gym membership contribution, and last but not least, you will have the chance to participate in our well-known yearly ugly Xmas sweater competition!
   

  

**Life at Quinyx**
 We are an innovative, agile and continuously growing modern tech company. We value passion, creativity, quality and simplicity. You’ll be given the opportunity to make an impact and directly contribute to our success, bring new ideas and have full ownership of your area.
   

  

 Our global team, of 30 nationalities, have fun together whether it is during a typical Swedish Fika, workshop, going for a run with a colleague or spending time together during our regular after-work socials. We have built a family atmosphere here at Quinyx and are committed to share knowledge and support one another!
   

  

**Want to join the family?**
 At Quinyx, we provide equal employment opportunities and we strive to have an inclusive and diverse value-driven culture. All applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability or Veteran status.
   

  

**Happy Workforce, Happy Business!**
*All candidates are subject to background checks.*

title: Senior Frontend Engineer
description:
* Application Deadline: Dec. 31, 2025
* Hybrid


**Job Description**
**What you'll get to do**
 You'll play a pivotal role in moving our new frontend forward, collaborating closely with your team to deliver innovative solutions that delight our users. You´ll team up with frontenders in the team to drive all of our technical projects on the Frontend side and create the best possible plattform for Detectify and our customers. You'll work in a cloud-first environment, leveraging your expertise to create scalable and performant applications that make a significant impact on our product and the user experience.
   

  

 We foster an enabling and empowered culture where you'll have the freedom to utilize your full skill set and express your unique personality. We encourage open, passionate discussions to fuel our collective learning and growth, creating a fun and engaging environment where your contributions are valued.
   

  

**As an Front-end engineer in a cross-functional product team** 
 , you'll contribute to the entire development cycle: ideation to iteration, and everything in between:
   

  

* Collaborate with engineers, designers, product managers, researchers, and data analysts in a dynamic and empowered product-driven environment
* Drive architecture together with your team within your domain and contribute to decisions across teams
* Use the latest technologies to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scale
* Explore modern software development methods
* Occationally contribute to the full stack

**Technologies you will get your hands on (some not all):**
* React, TypeScript, GraphQL (Apollo Federation)
* AI powered tools such co-pilot and alike
* BE technologies such as: Go (Golang), Kafka, Terraform, AWS ECS/Lambda/AppSync/RDS/DynamoDB


**Skills & Requirements**
**Who you are**
* You're energized by understanding user needs and translating them into intuitive, high-impact solutions.
* You have a deep understanding of modern frontend technologies and best practices, and you're always eager to learn and grow.
* You have experienced in frontend architecture and have driven technical projects from inception to completion.
* You are eager to contribute to the full tech stack
* You embrace collaborative development approaches like pair or mob programming, valueing the diverse perspectives they bring to the table.
* You´re proficient in cloud technologies, especially AWS, and understand backend integration.


**So, what do you think?**
 We are proud to foster an inclusive workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to be a part of changing the way the world thinks about security! Go hack yourself!
   

  

**Hybrid work**
 This position is for the Stockholm office.
 *We do not offer remote working or offer relocation for this position*

title: Product Lead, Courier Acquisition & Onboarding
description:
**About Wolt**
 At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.
   

  

 Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.
   

  

 We are looking for a Product Lead to join the Courier Acquisition & Onboarding team within the Courier product group. This team sits at the heart of Wolt’s growth. Our job is to ensure that anyone who wants to become a courier partner can discover Wolt, apply with ease, and get on the road quickly, confidently, and compliantly. We own the full funnel: from first touchpoint to activation, and everything in between. We obsess over removing friction, personalizing journeys for different markets, and building an onboarding experience that’s not only fast and efficient but also welcoming and supportive because the start of a courier’s journey defines the quality of our service for everyone.
   

  

 In this role, you’ll lead Wolt’s courier acquisition funnel from awareness to onboarding and activation. You’ll own the product vision and roadmap, identifying and addressing funnel bottlenecks through data, experimentation, and rapid iteration.
   

  

 Working cross-functionally with marketing, operations, engineering, design, and data, you’ll build seamless, scalable onboarding experiences. You’ll deeply understand courier needs and champion their journey, ensuring every step, from discovery to activation, is optimized and delightful.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 You could come to this role from a multitude of different backgrounds, but ideally, you have
   

  

* You have 5+ years of experience in product management, growth, or marketing roles, with a strong track record managing user or merchant acquisition funnels, onboarding flows, or conversion journeys. Experience in logistics, gig economy, or three-sided marketplaces is a plus, but not required.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to influence cross-functional teams and senior stakeholders. You communicate clearly, bring stakeholders together, and drive alignment in fast-moving, multicultural environments.
* Desire to be in a high-ownership, high-visibility role. You're comfortable driving the strategic vision while also getting hands-on, solving complex problems, and navigating ambiguity with a builder’s mindset.
* A mixture of data analysis skills, engineering understanding, and business savvy — paired with the go-getter attitude of a “could-be startup CEO.” You’re confident digging into data, defining metrics, building dashboards, and running A/B tests — always balancing evidence with intuition.
* Expertise in leading cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and data experts. You’re passionate about great UX and know how to collaborate with designers to ship beautiful, intuitive products.


**Next steps**
 The position will be filled as soon as we find the right person, so make sure to apply as soon as you realize you really, really want to join us!
   

  

 The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash RSUs. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
   

  

 We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Producer - Games
description:
Embark is hiring a Producer to join Arc Raiders. As a member of the production team, you will partner with creative stakeholders to help multiple teams deliver on their goals. You have a drive for removing obstacles, solving problems, and making sure things get done. You know that helping a team work better is a mix of high-minded organizational principles and practical compromises. And you must play games, understand games, and have a deep interest in games as an entertainment medium.
   

  

 At Embark, we believe in building teams of game makers - people who have ownership over the piece of the game they’re creating. As a Producer here, you are a safe pair of hands and the safety net below the creative and technical people who are the very best in the industry at what they do.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Be a servant leader for multiple cross-functional teams, helping them continuously improve and iterate on the game making process
* Foresee potential roadblocks in the future, proactively addressing them or bringing the right people together to address them
* Generally problem-solve with your teams to maximize the benefit to player experience within our constraints
* Manage the development process for your teams, nurturing sustainable day-to-day, sprint-to-sprint, and milestone-to-milestone rhythms of production
* Communicate and overcommunicate with your teams, stakeholders, and external teams - horizontally, vertically, and around corners


**We would love if you have**
* 5 years of experience as a producer or team lead
* Experience with live service titles and their development cadence
* Experience with the benefits and drawbacks of working with cross-functional teams
* Excellent communication skills that allow you to explain complex ideas and motivate teams through mutual understanding
* A proactive, humble, and conscientious attitude, with a high sense of ownership and autonomy
* An organized and detail-oriented mindset, the ability to thrive within ambiguity and messiness, and the patience to bring the former to tame the latter
* A lifetime of experience playing videogames and a longtime fascination with the craft of making them


*For this role we are only considering candidates already residing in Sweden.*
 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!

title: Senior Software Engineer - Malmö
description:
Senior Software Engineer
  
Assignment Description
  
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with strong leadership skills to join our team. In this role, you will be required to work on-site three days per week, collaborating with a dynamic team of developers.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Familiarity with SEO principles and accessibility guidelines.
  
Exposure to cloud-based technologies and experience working with complex, large-scale systems.
  
Hands-on experience with front-end frameworks and libraries such as React, Svelte, and Vue, with the ability to evaluate and compare them.

Strong communicator, capable of clearly explaining technical decisions.
  
A passion for solving problems, simplifying complex challenges, and improving efficiency.
  
Collaborative, curious, and passionate about continuous learning.
  
  

Work Location
  
Hybrid (on-site three days per week)
  
  

Location
  
Malmö, Sweden

title: IT & OT Supporttekniker
description:
Vi söker en IT/OT-supporttekniker med energi, driv och ett genuint intresse för att hjälpa andra. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utvecklas inom både IT och OT, och vara en nyckelperson för att våra verksamheter alltid har ett fungerande systemstöd och en stabil infrastruktur.

**NSVA IT**  

IT, Digitalisering och säkerhet ansvarar för att driva organisationens digitala transformation och säkerställa att alla tekniska lösningar stödjer verksamhetens mål. Vi arbetar med att utveckla och förbättra digitala processer, integrera nya teknologier och säkerställa en trygg och effektiv IT-miljö.

### **Om rollen**

* Du är verksamhetens första kontakt vid tekniska frågor och incidenter inom både IT och OT.
* Du samordnar och följer upp ärenden mot vår outsourcade IT-leverantör och säkerställer att leveranser håller rätt kvalitet och tempo.
* Du bygger relationer och skapar trygghet för användarna genom ett professionellt och serviceinriktat bemötande.
* Du arbetar nära både verksamheten och externa leverantörer för att snabbt fånga upp och hantera användarnas behov.
* Du kommunicerar lösningar på ett pedagogiskt sätt och bidrar till att utveckla våra arbetssätt inom support och infrastruktur.
* Du får möjlighet att utvecklas inom både IT och OT och vara med och påverka hur vi arbetar med support och digitala lösningar.

### **Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**

* Ge support till användare inom IT och OT, både på plats och på distans.
* Felsöka och åtgärda problem i datorer, nätverk, system och automationsmiljöer.
* Säkerställa att systemstöd och infrastruktur är tillgängliga och fungerar stabilt.
* Hantera och dokumentera ärenden i ärendehanteringssystem.
* Vara den naturliga länken mellan verksamheten och IT-leverantören – ta emot, vidarebefordra och följa upp ärenden och beställningar.
* Delta i installation, uppgradering och underhåll av hårdvara och mjukvara.

### **Vi söker dig som har**

* Gymnasieutbildning inom IT/teknik eller motsvarande.
* Stort intresse för teknik, support och problemlösning.
* Mycket god servicekänsla och förmåga att kommunicera pedagogiskt.
* Driv, energi och vilja att utvecklas och lära nytt.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och ta egna initiativ.
* God samarbetsförmåga och vilja att bygga relationer med verksamheten och externa leverantörer.

### **Meriterande**

* Erfarenhet av supportarbete, ärendehantering alternativt arbete i automationsmiljö.
* Vana att arbeta med outsourcade IT-leverantörer eller i samverkan med externa parter.
* Erfarenhet av dokumentation och struktur i supportprocesser.
* Intresse för både IT och OT samt vilja att utvecklas inom automationsmiljöer.
* **Vi erbjuder**
* En dynamisk och innovativ arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att påverka och utveckla verksamheten.
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande och utmanande projekt inom digitalisering och säkerhet.
* Kompetensutveckling och möjlighet att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknologierna och trenderna.
* En arbetsplats som värdesätter ansvar, kompetens och arbetsglädje.

### **Mer information**


I tjänsten kommer du att arbeta med säkerhetsklassad information. Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll kommer därför att genomföras i samband med anställning. Svenskt medborgarskap krävs, dubbelt medborgarskap är ok om det ena är svenskt.


Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse, men gärna så fort som möjligt. Har du några frågor är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Andreas Hauser, IT och Digitaliseringschef via andreas.hauser@nsva.se eller 010-490 97 77.

### **Ansökan**


Skicka din ansökan med CV och personligt brev senast 2025-11-09. Vi arbetar med löpande urval under denna rekrytering och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan ansökningstiden har gått ut.
