title: Senior IT Support Manager
description:
**Company Overview**
====================


NOTICS is a fast-growing Managed IT Service Provider (MSP) tech startup, focused on delivering cutting-edge, reliable technology solutions that empower businesses to scale and transform lives. As we continue to grow in the US market, our mission is to build a team of ambitious professionals who thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment and are obsessed with helping clients solve their IT challenges. In partnership with our client—a nonprofit dedicated to creating opportunities and transforming lives for children and adults with neurological, developmental, mental health, and orthopedic conditions—we provide innovative, holistic IT support that breaks down barriers to care and enables exceptional results in a warm, compassionate space.

**Job Overview**
================


We are seeking an experienced Senior IT Manager to join our Managed Service Provider (MSP) team. In this role, you will be exclusively dedicated to supporting our nonprofit client. This position offers a unique blend of the stability that comes with supporting a consistent, mission-driven environment along with the professional growth opportunities available within an MSP setting. The ideal candidate will serve as the technical backbone for our client's day-to-day IT operations, approaching each task with patience, technical prowess, and empathy. With the full support and resources of our MSP behind you, you'll help maximize access to innovative services, celebrate the individual, inspire excellence, serve with integrity, and lead with passion—aligning with our client's core values to foster dignity, empowerment, and transformative outcomes.

**Key Responsibilities**
========================

* Serve as the primary technical point of contact for our nonprofit client, building strong, respectful relationships and understanding their unique IT environment and the sensitive business needs of a nonprofit serving individuals in recovery.
* Provide expert-level troubleshooting and resolution for complex technical issues across hardware, software, network infrastructure, and cloud services, always prioritizing dignity, empathy, and empowerment in user interactions.
* Manage and maintain client systems including servers, workstations, network devices, and security solutions, ensuring proactive measures that support our client's mission to create opportunities and transform lives.
* Implement IT projects and initiatives for our client in collaboration with our MSP team, embracing problem-solving, personal responsibility, and courageous growth to deliver exceptional results.
* Document all support activities, maintain knowledge base articles, and develop standard operating procedures, contributing to a results-driven team grounded in purpose and dynamic collaboration.
* Proactively monitor systems to identify and address potential issues before they impact our client's operations, honoring the privilege of serving their community of passionate advocates, experts, helpers, leaders, and teachers.
* Coordinate with third-party vendors when necessary to resolve complex issues, maintaining professional, affirming interactions that uphold superior standards.
* Provide clear technical guidance and training to end-users of varying technical abilities, approaching each session with compassion and a focus on empowering individuals where they are in their journey.
* Participate in on-call rotation to provide after-hours emergency support as needed, demonstrating sincere commitment to our client's vision of maximizing access to innovative services.
* Contribute expertise to the broader MSP team by sharing knowledge and best practices, inspiring excellence through positive thinking and collective spirit.

**Qualifications and Skills**
=============================

* 5+ years of experience in IT support roles with progressive responsibility.
* Strong technical knowledge across Windows/Mac environments, network infrastructure, and cloud services.
* Experience with remote monitoring and management (RMM) tools and professional services automation (PSA) platforms.
* Excellent troubleshooting skills with the ability to diagnose and resolve complex technical issues.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical users in a respectful, empathetic manner.
* Proven ability to manage multiple priorities while maintaining attention to detail, especially in sensitive, high-impact environments.
* Experience with ticketing systems and IT service management processes.
* Self-motivated with the ability to work independently while being an effective team player, embracing our client's culture of positive thinkers who value dignity, empathy, and empowerment.
* Natural empathy and understanding of delicate situations, such as those involving individuals recovering from traumatic injuries or mental health challenges, with a passion for serving communities in need.

**Core Values**
===============


At NOTICS, our core values align seamlessly with those of our partners, emphasizing a shared commitment to transformative impact:

* **Competitive Greatness**: The relentless pursuit of excellence and surpassing expectations in all we do, inspiring excellence through innovative IT solutions that deliver exceptional results.
* **Unimpeachable Character**: Be the type of person with whom people are always proud to associate, personally and professionally, serving with integrity and celebrating the individual in every interaction.
* **Sincere Candor**: Feedback is the compass for greatness; it tells you what to avoid, what to learn, and where to excel, leading with passion to foster courageous growth and dynamic collaboration.
* 

**What We Offer**
=================

* Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
* Professional development opportunities and support for certifications, encouraging personal responsibility and lifelong learning.
* Work with a collaborative team of IT professionals in a supportive, results-driven environment.
* Balanced workload with the opportunity to develop deep expertise with a dedicated client, where your efforts directly contribute to life-changing work.
* Career growth path within our expanding MSP, grounded in purpose and focused on impact.
* Modern, flexible work environment that honors work-life balance and empowers you to thrive.

title: Senior Solution Architect Dynamics 365 Supply chain management
description:
*Vi har en stark position inom Data & AI samt Business Solutions och nu söker vi dig som är arkitekt idag med gedigen erfarenhet inom Dynamics 365 Supply Chain och vill ta ytterligare steg som entreprice arkitekt och skapa de mest värdeskapande moderna Supply Chain-lösningarna med dagens och morgondagens tekniska kapacitet.*

*Hos oss får du möjlighet att leda utvecklingen av framtidens lösningar och driva vår strategi mot autonoma ERP, tillsammans med några av branschens främsta experter.*

*Låter det spännande? Då är den här rollen något för dig!*

##### **Din roll hos oss**


Du är en av våra seniora lösningsarkitekter och tar övergripande ansvar för våra lösningar. Du leder designmöten och workshops, coachar kollegor och säkerställer att våra lösningar gör verklig skillnad för kund. Vi arbetar agilt i harmoni med Microsofts arbetssätt (FastTrack, Solution by Design) och vårt eget ramverk DAM – Digital Adoption Model, baserat på Scrum. Hos oss jobbar vi alltid i teamleveranser – vi tror på att det ger bäst resultat för både kund och medarbetare.

#### **Vi vill jobba med dig som**


Har gedigen erfarenhet av Dynamics 365 Supply Chain och har en bred ERP-profil med förståelse för exempelvis produkthantering, distribution, lager, logistikprocesser och integrationer inom industri eller detaljhandel.


Du gillar digitala utmaningar och vill skapa nästa generations verksamhetsprocesser med fokus på automatiserade flöden. Din analytiska förmåga, kommunikativa styrka och erfarenhet gör dig till en självklar ledare i våra projekt.

##### **Vi söker dig som:**

* Har ca 7+ års erfarenhet av implementationsprojekt inom Dynamics 365 Supply Chain och dess starka koppling till Finance
* Har ansvarat för arkitekturdesign och säkerställt att lösningar möter affärsbehov
* Är van vid agila projekt och vill bidra till att utveckla vårt arbetssätt

##### **Vårt team**


Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat och prestigelöst team med djup teknisk kompetens inom Dynamics 365 Finance & Supply Chain management. Vi är en härlig blandning av arkitekter, utvecklare, applikation- och processpecialister som delar en passion för att digitalisera och optimera våra kunders verksamheter med hjälp av ny teknik från Microsoft.


Att arbeta i team är centralt för oss på Accigo. Vi värdesätter mångfalden av perspektiv och erfarenheter som våra kollegor bidrar med – det är genom samarbete som vi skapar hållbara, innovativa och effektiva lösningar för våra kunder. Tillsammans kombinerar vi teknisk kompetens med verksamhetsförståelse och arbetar tätt med kollegor från andra affärsområden för att säkerställa framgångsrika projekt och långsiktiga relationer.

##### **Kompensation och förmåner**


Vår förmånspolicy är utvecklad för att möta både dina professionella och personliga behov. I vårt omfattande förmånspaket ingår friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och sjukvårdsförsäkring. Vår ersättningsmodell består av en konkurrenskraftig fast del och en rörlig del som ger dig möjlighet att påverka din lön baserat på din prestation och ambition. Detta ger dig frihet att balansera din ersättningsnivå med dina livsprioriteringar. Vi erbjuder både professionell och personlig utveckling.

**Nyfiken?** Hör av dig till oss – vi tar gärna en kaffe och berättar mer: amir.hosseini@accigo.se

title: Lead Solution Architect – Core Technology Team
description:
**Location**: Sveavägen 168, Stockholm, Sweden (On-site)  

**Company**: Apotea AB – Sweden’s leading online pharmacy  

**Team**: Core Technology  

  

**Tech Innovation at Apotea**  

Apotea is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, committed to making healthcare products accessible and efficient for everyone. We’re on a mission to build the next generation of e-commerce and logistics, from scratch, but with lots of domain expertise and genuine care for our customers (We have been selected as the best e-commerce in Sweden several years in a row — and for good reason.). Our vision in the Tech department is to redefine how AI and automation power modern businesses — not by forcing AI into traditional workflows, but by creating AI-driven and automated systems that give humans control, insight, and the ability to apply their expertise where it matters most.


The Core Technology Team shapes the architectural foundation that supports everything we do — from e-commerce and logistics to data, AI/ML, and customer experience. We ensure that every development aligns with our long-term vision and contributes to Apotea’s growth.


We are now looking for a Lead Solution Architect to take end-to-end ownership of Apotea’s solution architecture, ensure technical excellence, and enable our teams to deliver at scale.  

  

**The Role**  

As Lead Solution Architect, you’ll sit at the heart of Apotea’s transformation. You will define and evolve our architecture across AWS (serverless-first) and help us realize a platform that is scalable, resilient, and ready for continuous innovation.


This role combines strategic leadership with hands-on architectural design. At Apotea, engineers are expected to take ownership of the full software development life cycle, so your role will be both to design solutions yourself and enable other engineers to do so effectively. You will work closely with business stakeholders, engineers, and product owners to ensure every technical development is aligned with Apotea’s vision, architectural principles, and best practices.


You will also be the first-line responsible person for all technical developments and initiatives in the Tech department, advocating a product mindset and ensuring our architecture enables both speed and sustainability. We believe in balancing fast go-to-market with long-term maintainability: *we like the right amount of technical debt, at the right place, and for the right purpose*. Part of your role will be to define maturity plans and guide iterations as systems evolve.


Finally, you must be able to take complex topics and clarify them, communicating solution designs and execution plans in a way that aligns the whole organization.

 **Key Responsibilities**

*Architectural Leadership:*

* Own and evolve Apotea’s target architecture with a strong focus on AWS serverless, event-driven, and data-driven systems.
* Translate business strategy into modern, sustainable technology roadmaps.
* Establish architectural guardrails and best practices for scalability, cost efficiency, and security.

*Solution Design & Innovation:*

* Design end-to-end solutions for e-commerce, logistics, and AI/ML-powered workflows.
* Enable engineers to take ownership of design and execution, while sometimes leading design work yourself.
* Identify and evaluate emerging technologies that can transform customer experience and operational efficiency.
* Ensure solutions deliver on availability, observability, performance, and regulatory compliance.
* Contribute to Apotea’s architectural “toolbox” — principles, guidelines, standards, and reusable patterns.
* 

*Collaboration & Leadership:*

* Work closely with product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment of technology and goals.
* Mentor and coach architects and engineers, fostering a design-first, product-oriented, innovation-driven culture.
* Act as a trusted advisor to leadership, balancing risks, trade-offs, and opportunities.

*Governance & Compliance:*

* Embed data privacy, sovereignty, and security considerations into all architectural decisions, with close collaboration with Security Engineer.
* Ensure solutions comply with healthcare regulations and GDPR.

**We are looking for someone with:**

* Extensive experience in solution/software architecture, including previous experience as the main and go-to architect in an organization.
* Proven expertise in AWS with deep knowledge of serverless, distributed applications, event-driven and microservices architecture.
* Strong background in designing secure, scalable, and high-performance systems.
* Ability to balance fast iterations with technical debt management, defining maturity plans for systems.
* Familiarity with C4 model or similar for clear architectural communication.
* Experience in AI/ML platforms, data-driven architectures, or automation workflows is a plus.
* Excellent ability to collaborate across business and tech, with strong communication and leadership skills.
* Experience with programming languages such as Go, TypeScript, and .NET.

**Nice to Have**

* Experience with MLOps and data lakehouse architectures.
* Knowledge of multi-tenant SaaS or distributed e-commerce and logistics platforms.
* Exposure to regulated environments such as healthcare, finance, or logistics.
* Familiarity with API/Event-first design and Test Driven Development (TDD).

**Why Join Apotea?**  



* A stable, future-focused company with a meaningful mission to improve healthcare accessibility.
* The chance to work on cutting-edge AI, ML, and automation projects that impact millions of customers.
* Opportunity to Work with modern cloud-native technologies (serverless, AI, automation, event-driven).
* Join a flat, agile organization with minimal bureaucracy
* Opportunities for career growth through training, mentorship, and industry conferences.
* Collaborate in a cross-functional, transparent environment
* Own projects from concept to deployment
* Join a culture of experimentation, collaboration, and innovation.

**About Apotea**  

Apotea.se is Sweden’s largest online pharmacy, with the country’s broadest range of over 32,000 non-prescription items and nearly 19,000 prescription drugs for humans and animals. Recognized as Sweden’s most sustainable e-commerce company (Sustainable Brand Index 2021), we simplify everyday life for our customers with fast deliveries and expert advice. In 2024, Apotea reached a turnover of SEK 6.5 billion and currently employs about 1,000 people across Stockholm, Lidingö, and Morgongåva.  

  

Apotea is an inclusive employer that values diversity. We welcome all applicants and strive to create a work environment where people, regardless of background, gender, age, religion, or disability, can thrive and grow.  

  

**Recruitment Process**

  


* Apply


* Interview: Screening
* Interview: Technical Capabilities


* Interview: Culture Fit


* Background Check: As a pharmacy, we always conduct a background check.


* Offer Presented


**Application**  

Do not hesitate to send in your application already today. For more information or questions, visit our career page or contact us at jobb@apotea.se. We do not accept applications via email.  

  

LinkedIn  

Instagram  

  

***Join Us and Make a Difference -*** ***We hope you want to be a part of our team!***  

*Submit your application today—interviews are conducted on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled immediately. Start date by agreement.*  

  

*Welcome to Apotea – where technology meets health and creates magic!*

title: Junior IT-Supporttekniker till myndighet
description:
### **OM JOBBET**


Vi söker en driven och serviceinriktad IT-Supporttekniker till vår kund i Stockholm. Du kommer att utföra på-plats-support till användare i allmänna IT-frågor/Helpdesk och på plats i kommunens olika verksamheter.

### **OM FÖRETAGET**


Kunden är en av Sveriges mest välskötta kommuner med stor valfrihet, välfärdstjänster av hög kvalitet, attraktivt näringslivsklimat och stabil ekonomi. Skolorna i kommunen uppvisar toppresultat, förskolorna erbjuder en trygg och stimulerande miljö och vid kommunens äldreboenden är nöjdheten stor. Läget är attraktivt med närhet till både Stockholm och Arlanda, samtidigt som tillgången till skog, hav och strövområden ger möjlighet till naturupplevelser och rekreation.  

  



### **ARBETSUPPGIFTER**


Kontakt med användare sker via telefon (bemanna Servicedesk) och ärendehanteringssystem men även att bemanna supportdesk och hjälpa användare fysiskt på plats hos kundens kontor. Även support/ärendehantering på plats i kommunens olika verksamheter förekommer. Konsulten ska arbeta på plats hos kundens lokaler.


### **ERFARENHETER OCH EGENSKAPER**

* Minst 1 års erfarenhet inom IT-support
* Körkort är ett krav

### **ÖVRIGT**


Kvällsarbete kan förekomma.

### **OM D-SOURCE**

*Your source to IT*  

D-Source är ett modernt konsultbolag med bredden mellan helpdesk, infrastruktur och Tech. Vi har lång erfarenhet av att förstå kunders IT-behov! Tveka inte att höra av dig om du är intresserad av att ta reda på mer.


Vad kan vi göra för dig och vad kan vi göra tillsammans?  

  



### **INGET JOBB FÖR DIG?**


Lugnt! Du kan alltid registrera dig förutsättningslöst på D-Source jobbsida genom att Connecta med oss. Då hamnar du i vår kandidatdatabas och får koll på våra kommande aktuella tjänster.

title: Senior Software Engineer - JavaScript
description:
**About Us**


With over 85 million global active users and 2,5 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?

 **What You Will Do**

* Tackle specific problem spaces critical to Klarna’s current needs, with ample growth opportunities in a fast-paced business environment.
* Bring innovative ideas from diverse areas, including information retrieval, large-scale system design, data storage/processing, security, artificial intelligence, UI design, and mobile development.
* Develop your professional skills in an entrepreneurial organization that encourages working with your areas of interest.
* Use state-of-the-art technology to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scale.
* Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software; take full responsibility for the lifecycle of your code.
* Share your knowledge and help the team evolve best practices; act as both a mentor and mentee.
* Work in small, autonomous teams with short release cycles.
* Contribute to open source projects: Klarna GitHub.

 **Who You Are**

* Proficient in TypeScript and Node.js.
* Experienced with common JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
* Skilled in React and React Native.
* Knowledgeable in product development, cloud technologies, and microservices.
* Passionate about writing clean and testable code.
* Familiar with Agile practices, including Pairing, TDD, BDD, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Delivery.

 **Technologies We Work With**

* JavaScript / TypeScript
* React + React Native with Redux
* Node.js and Express.js
* REST API and GraphQL API
* Kafka
* Internal design system
* AWS, Splunk, Datadog, Jenkins, and Docker

 **Closing**  

Please include a CV in English.

title: Systems Engineer - Corp IT
description:
Are you a skilled Systems Engineer with deep knowledge of infrastructure technologies, both on-prem and in the cloud? We’re now looking for someone like you to join our team in Stockholm office. 
 



 In this role, you’ll work closely with fellow Systems Engineers to build and support corporate services, while continuously improving best practices for technical operations. You’re driven by a strong desire to learn and apply modern and emerging technologies with passion.
 



 You’ll connect the dots across various business needs in multiple locations, identifying the best approaches and solutions to ensure services are professionally supported while remaining cost-effective.
 



 You’re a true team player who works well independently with minimal supervision and enjoys consulting with others and sharing your knowledge.
 


**A taster of what you will be involved with** 

 Your main goal is ultimately to build and support corporate services and improve technical operations best practices for the team. To this end, you will be expected to
 


* Maintain and develop Corporate Infrastructure supporting the Betsson’s business requirements.
* Maintain and develop documentation and knowledge sharing in through online tools.
* Take ownership of systems and service monitoring.
* Focus on implementing continual improvement.
* Provide technical expertise to enable the correct application of operational procedures.
* Contributes to architecting technical solutions to meet Betsson’s dynamic business requirements.
* Contributes to the planning and implementation of maintenance and installation work.
* Identifies operational problems and contributes to their resolution, checking that they are managed in accordance with agreed standards and procedures.
* Administration and handling of Betsson’s Cloud and On-Prem Infrastructure, Corporate Services such as Active Directory and Office 365, amongst others.
* Uses standard procedures and tools to carry out defined system backups, restoring data where necessary.
* First point of contact for IT support, infrastructure projects, local management and vendors/supplier coordination.
* Maintenance responsibility of all IT equipment in the office (Server room, UPS, Meeting Rooms AV Setup, Mobile Phones etc.)
* Be expected to work on call and/or on shifts as per business requirements.


**What we are looking for** 
* Experience on traditional infrastructure On-Prem, including servers and storage components
* Knowledge of virtualization technologies (VMWare / Hyper-V), monitoring technologies and tools
* Knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft 365 services and SCCM.
* Experience on MS SQL (Or Similar)
* Hands-on experience managing Microsoft Sharepoint
* Experience managing Microsoft Azure and Entra ID (Azure AD)
* Skilled in Mobile Device Management (MDM) solutions Intune, SCCM and Kandji
* Knowledge of procedures and tools to carry out defined system and data backups and restores
* Service mindset
* Willingness to go the extra mile for supporting colleagues
* Clear verbal and written communication skills in both Swedish and English


**Would be great to also possess** 
* Tertiary Education and / or a bachelor’s degree in IT / Computer Science.
* Experience on infrastructure including Cloud Services (especially AWS and Azure).
* Coding Experience and Scripting Skills (C#, Python, PowerShell, Node JS).
* Experience using IaC (Terraform / Ansible).
* Automation, Security, Configuration and Version Management skills.
* Vender specific certifications (AWS, Microsoft, VMWare, Cisco, Veeam).


**What we offer** 


 Much like a rollercoaster, life at Betsson Group is fast-paced, full of twists and turns, and always exciting. With more than 
 **2,800** 
 colleagues representing over 75 nationalities 
 **across a global network of offices** 
  – including 
 **1,500** 
  at our operational headquarters in Malta – every day brings new challenges and opportunities to grow. It may not be for the faint-hearted, but if you thrive on innovation, enjoy pushing boundaries and want to be part of a diverse, international team, then you’ll fit right in at Betsson.
 



 Challenge accepted?
 
***By submitting your application, you understand that your personal data will be processed as set out in our Privacy Policy***

title: IT Security Specialist to Operational Security Center | SEB, Sweden
description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fuelled by collaboration. From High-Code to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!
   

  

 We are looking for a skilled and communicative IT Security Specialist to join the Operational Security Center (OSC) at SEB in Stockholm. This is a key role where you will act as a subject matter expert (SME) in security projects and initiatives across the bank, helping to strengthen SEB’s overall security posture.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an IT Security Specialist, you will work hands-on with technical security while also driving improvements and implementing new services. You will contribute to the continuous development of our operational security capabilities — including penetration testing, vulnerability management, incident response/CTI, and security engineering, while engaging with stakeholders to translate findings into actionable advice.
   

  

**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Have**
* A background in hands-on security work — from scripting and building to operating, analyzing and troubleshooting.
* Fluency in English and Swedish.
* Familiarity with cloud security concepts and monitoring tools.
* A solid understanding of common attack vectors, security vulnerabilities, and mitigation techniques.
* Experience with security tools and technologies such as SIEM/SOAR, network security solutions, and endpoint detection and response (XDR) systems.
* Practical experience in security incident handling, analysis, and response.
* The ability to translate technical findings into clear and actionable recommendations for stakeholders.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, enabling you to work effectively with both technical and non-technical audiences.
* A proactive mindset with strong ownership, a commitment to continuous improvement, and experience in driving initiatives and delivering presentations.


**What We Offer**
* Agile and modern ways of working
* A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Challenging, cutting-edge work
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from. Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-10-16. If you have questions about the position, please contact hiring manager Torbjörn Askenberg, note that we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career https://bit.ly/SEBcareer
   

  

 SEB Sweden has a redeployment responsibility, which is why this position might be covered by internal redeployment.

title: Creative Strategist
description:
Happy Mammoth is a fast-growing natural food tech business selling across the United States, Australia and Europe. We specialize in formulating, producing and marketing gut, digestive and microbiome health foods and natural supplements, designed to help our clients make long-lasting positive health changes and start living very full lives again.
   

  

 Why You'll Love Working at Happy Mammoth
   

  

* Competitive Salary – Your skills and expertise deserve to be rewarded
* Paid Holidays – Relax, recharge, and enjoy well-earned time off
* Work from Anywhere – Your home, a cozy café, or a beachside co-working space—it’s your call!
* Join a Supportive, Global Team – Work with passionate professionals from around the world
* Flexible Working Hours – Manage your schedule in a way that works best for you
* Growth Opportunities – Access free books, courses, and resources to expand your expertise
* Exciting & Dynamic Work Environment – Every day brings new challenges and opportunities
* Make a Real Impact – Help create products that improve people’s lives


 We are looking for a Creative Strategist to join our growing Marketing Team on a full-time basis.
   

  

 Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:
   

  

 📍This is a full-time fully remote contractor role
   

  

 📍We are seeking someone preferably with a background in B2C marketing
   

  

 📍Although the role is remote, the candidate must be available during EU hours (GMT)
   

  

 Your primary role will center on digital media advertising with a keen focus on enhancing our ad campaigns.
   

  

 As a Creative Strategist, you will be responsible for developing innovative and effective strategies that align with our company's objectives and resonate with our target audience. Your role will blend creativity with strategic thinking to drive impactful campaigns and initiatives. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, design, product development, to ensure cohesive messaging and brand consistency across all channels. The ideal candidate will possess a combination of analytical skills, creative flair, and a deep understanding of consumer behavior and market trends.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Strategy Development:
+ Develop comprehensive creative strategies that support business goals and objectives
+ Conduct thorough research and analysis to identify market trends, consumer insights, and competitive landscapes
+ Translate insights into actionable strategies that differentiate our brand and resonate with our target audience


* Campaign Planning and Execution:
+ Collaborate with internal teams to conceptualize and execute integrated marketing campaigns across various channels, including digital, social media, print, and events
+ Develop creative briefs and provide clear direction to design and content teams to ensure alignment with strategic objectives
+ Monitor campaign performance and metrics to evaluate effectiveness and identify areas for optimization


* Brand Development and Positioning:
+ Contribute to the development and evolution of our brand identity and messaging
+ Ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints and communication channels
+ Identify opportunities for brand positioning and differentiation in the marketplace


* Cross-Functional Collaboration:
+ Work closely with marketing, design, product development, and sales teams to ensure alignment of messaging and strategy
+ Foster a collaborative environment that encourages creative thinking and innovation
+ Communicate effectively with stakeholders to gather input and feedback on creative initiatives


* Trend Analysis and Innovation:
+ Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and cultural shifts
+ Apply insights to inform creative strategies and develop innovative solutions
+ Experiment with new approaches and techniques to continually improve campaign performance and engagement


 Qualifications:
   

  

* Proven experience in a creative strategy role, preferably in an advertising agency or marketing department
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and insights to drive strategic decisions
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and persuasively
* Creative mindset with a passion for developing innovative and compelling campaigns
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively
* Proficiency in digital marketing platforms and tools
* Familiarity with design principles and an eye for aesthetics
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to change
* Strong collaborative spirit and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams


 CVs must be in ENGLISH.
   

  

 Powered by JazzHR

title: Program Director
description:
We are a $13+ billion global technology company, home to more than 220,000+ people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering, cloud, and AI, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products.
 



  





 HCLTech is a globally recognized leader in the Tech and IT industry, but we’ve never forgotten the startup mindset that got us here. We’ve always approached our work with an idea-first attitude because every one of our accomplishments —no matter how big or small —can be traced back to an idea’s single spark.
 



  





 It’s that spark —that inner drive —that sets our people apart from our competitors. It enables us not just to pull off game-changing feat after game-changing feat but to better our world in the process. We want you to find your spark. Because that’s what drives you to be better, be more and ultimately, be more fulfilled.
 



  





**Position: - Program Director** 




**Location-** 
 Stockholm
 **,** 
 Sweden
 



**Job Type-** 
 Full Time (Hybrid)
 



**Full time Employment** 
 - Permanent
 



  





**Position Overview** 



* The position requires delivery of program of projects by managing a team of transition managers and/or should be responsible for execution of large project, defining and developing Project Management methodologies by working closely with the PMO- Head.
* He/ she should be able to define processes and create WoW for projects or large operations in the IT Infrastructure space looks into overall project delivery and develop relationship with external and internal stakeholders including C-level executives.
* He/ She would be responsible for engaging in early phase of projects and work closely with the internal as well as external customer teams on Program delivery.
* The preferred candidate will have an extensive background in managing large scale Infrastructure operations, transitions and transformation projects in an outsourced environment.
* Candidate from an outsourcing organization/background would be an added advantage.



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Sets the direction for the entire Projects team, builds and leads a vibrant team Creates and manages a strong team of Project Managers or operational governance with clients Creates, Contributes and Implements the best practices Develops and lays down processes and procedure for streamlining execution of large operational engagements or projects as per organization s defined methodologies.
* Must have extensive experience in project/program management of Infrastructure projects
* Manage PnL for entire project portfolio and should be able to deliver projects within cost, schedule and quality.
* Must possess strong negotiation skills Contributes to business growth by expanding and enhancing current service offerings Awareness of and understands various Project Revenue
* Models Monitors the progress of all projects and deliverables Owns and is accountable for scope, effort, budget and delivery Drives continuous improvement in project deliveries and individual / team performance.
* Towards this, measures and analyzes deliveries and performance across projects and timeline.
* Contributes to annual planning of PMO and then executes it meticulously Is proactive and the ultimate escalation point on all matters related to all programs or engagements assigned in the region.
* Will look at Process efficiency and innovate methodology with a view to maximize value provided to the business units Establishes and maintains excellent relationships with customer / Business Units and can effectively manage all the stakeholders on either side.



  





**Experience** 



* Total 15+ years of experience, out of which at least 10+ years at a senior management level.
* Exceptional Infrastructure technical background primarily on Compute, Networks and Storage with core background in managing transformation Projects / Programs on Oracle DB platforms.
* Experience in managing diverse and multiple teams and complete ownership and responsibility of the team Hiring and retaining the best talent, performance management Managing aspirations of individuals Creating and implementing growth & development plans for the team Managing team motivation levels Resource planning and balanced resource utilization across different Projects Mandatory Skills To lead complex transition and transformation (T&T) engagements with our global clients independently.
* Strong Experience in managing medium and complex size infrastructure transformation program Understanding of contracts and bid management through to development of SOW s highly desirable. Manages conflict constructively, can identify areas of improvement in team thinking.
* Should have been managing a team of project Managers/operations managers/leads Should have good analytical skills and eyes of detail, assess risk thoroughly

title: Experienced professionals to our Logistics & Distribution practice (Stockholm and Malmö)
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, tax, and related services. During its 175-year history, our organization has grown tremendously in both scale and capabilities. Deloitte currently has approximately 457,000+ people in more than 150 countries and territories, and serves four out of five Fortune Global 500® companies. Yet, our shared culture and mission - to make an impact that matters - remains unchanged. This is evident not only in Deloitte’s work for clients, but also in our WorldClass ambition, our WorldClimate initiative and our ALL IN diversity and inclusion strategy.
   

  

  




**Job Description**

**Are you passionate about Supply Chain and eager to help clients navigate complex challenges at a leading management consulting firm?**




 Deloitte is looking for experienced professionals to join our Logistics & Distribution team in Sweden. We work with both global and local organizations in transforming and improving their logistics and distribution. We are known in the market for working close with senior management, operations as well as with IT at our clients.
   

  

  





 As an experienced Logistics & Distribution professional, you will be an integral part of innovative transformation projects, working directly with companies across various industries. We work across the end-to-end supply chain, mainly in the domains of logistic network design, warehouse design and operations, inventory rationalization, transport management and order management. Your main responsibilities will include:
   

  

  




* Design and implement best practice logistics & distribution transformation capabilities, processes and operating models
* Support clients in selecting and implementing technologies such as warehouse management systems, transport management systems, and order management systems
* Drive client engagements and manage project delivery


**Qualifications**

 To succeed in these roles, you have a strategic mindset, strong customer focus and experience from Logistics & Distribution and relevant technologies such as WMS, TMS, and OMS. Understanding customer requirements, business processes, end-to-end solutions, and organizational challenges is essential. We believe that you thrive in an international environment, have a broad experience and knowledge in several areas, are curious to learning and enjoy working team based.
   

  

  




* 2+ years of working experience from leading management consultant firm is a strong merit
* Relevant professional and/or project experience from logistics & distribution transformation and implementation projects. We value industry knowledge and subject matter expertise
* Strong leadership skills with experience leading teams in projects or in line organization
* Ability to lead and direct interaction with clients primarily in client-facing roles
* Understanding of end-to-end business process, best practices, and latest industry trends
* Solid project and program management skills (advisory, strategy, presentation, problem solving, coordination)
* Experience from logistics & distribution system providers such as Infor, Manhattan, Blue Yonder, and SAP
* Business sense, problem solving and analytical skills
* Professional level of English and Swedish in oral and written communication
* Travel flexibility


**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
   

  

  





 Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
   

  

  





**How to apply**




 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.
   

  

  





**Please submit your application as soon as possible, as we are reviewing applications on a rolling basis.** 
  

  

  





*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with To Find Out. https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/*




**Questions?**




 For questions regarding the application process, please contact Viktor Bornebusch Lundeberg, vbornebusch@deloitte.se
   

  

  





**We are looking forward to your application!**




 For further information on Deloitte, please visit www.deloitte.se
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.
   

  

  





**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Field Services Engineer
description:
ASMPT ENABLING THE DIGITAL WORLD
 



  





 Smartphones, computers, networks, self-driving cars, intelligent machines, the latest medical advances, renewable energy – the digital transformation makes our lives easier, safer, and more comfortable.
 



 And we are at the center of it all: The world's leading technology companies manufacture their products with innovative solutions from ASMPT.
 



  





**Field Service Engineer (Sweden )** 




  





 The ASMPT team is looking to immediately fill the following position at its Sollentuna location!
 



  





 With our SIPLACE SMT placement machines and DEK stencil printers we support electronics manufacturers all over the world on their path to the Smart #1 SMT Factory based on Industry 4.0 concepts.
 



 As the industry’s innovation and technology leader, our product portfolio stands for top quality, process integration and flexible best-in-class solutions. Our vision: We enable the digital world!
 



 Your responsibilities include:
 



  




* Deliver exceptional service to our customers
* Perform both preventive and corrective maintenance on ASMPT equipment
* Install and support the start-up of SMT equipment, including related accessories
* Conduct customer training and instruction on sold equipment, focusing on delivering both internal and external training sessions
* Carry out retrofits and upgrades—both software and hardware—on installed equipment
* Develop and maintain strong relationships with new and existing customers while identifying their needs
* Accurately document service, hotline, and project activities in the CRM system, aiming to improve service processes internally and externally
* Forward and monitor error messages and open issues from service and hotline activities, ensuring timely follow-up and resolution
* Be responsible for performing preventive as well as reactive service and maintenance on ASMPT-Equipment



  





 Your qualifications:
 



  




* Have proven experience in servicing, installing, and maintaining manufacturing equipment
* Have previous experience with SMT equipment is considered a strong advantage
* A genuine interest in technology and continuous learning
* An understanding of IT infrastructure with basic knowledge of Microsoft applications
* Strong interpersonal skills, a positive attitude, and a collaborative team spirit
* Have excellent communication, analytical, and organizational skills, with a clear focus on customer service
* Be Proficient in English, both spoken and written
* Have the ability to prioritize tasks and work consistently toward defined goals
* Be able to travel across European countries and be in possession of a valid driver’s license



  





 You want to drive forward the development of the Smart Factory with your ideas, in a great team, networked with leading international technology companies?
 



  





 In addition to a highly specialized and future oriented business you will also find challenging tasks and a high level of autonomy and responsibility. Our excellent working atmosphere proves that we live up to our values. And of course, we offer attractive compensation and fringe benefits.
 



  





 Did we raise your interest?

title: Sektionschef IT
description:
Hos oss är du med och driver utveckling av både verksamhet och ledarskap för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Till en av våra sektioner på It- avdelningen inom Sundbyberg söker vi nu en ledare som kan hjälpa oss i förflyttningen mot framtiden. Du har en avgörande roll i vår förändringsresa. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Som chef och ledare på Skatteverket ser du till helheten, skapar förutsättningar och agerar medvetet i vardagen. Tillsammans med andra arbetar du för att skapa värde med fokus på kunden, med grund i vårt samhällsbärande uppdrag. I ditt ledarskap möjliggör du utveckling och lärande genom att ge mandat och skapa stort handlingsutrymme; du förstärker och följer upp de beteenden och den kultur som behövs för att vi tillsammans ska kunna genomföra vårt uppdrag. Du förväntas agera och leda även om svaren inte är givna, vägvalen inte tydliga och arbetssätten inte självklara. Med mod och insikt utmanar du våra invanda tankesätt och arbetssätt och är själv öppen för att låta dig utmanas.
   

  

 Du uppmuntrar till samarbete och nytänkande, och skapar förutsättningar för ett aktivt medarbetarskap som leder till resultat, utveckling och en god arbetsmiljö. Du är chef för en it-sektion med medarbetare och konsulter på enheten gemensamma tjänster och där leder du högt tekniskt kompetenta medarbetare som jobbar med utveckling och underhåll av mjukvara. Du ingår i enhetens ledningsgrupp, rapporterar till enhetschefen och har tillsammans med övriga chefer ett helhetsansvar för verksamheten.
   

  

 Dina medarbetare arbetar i agila team inom ramverket SAFe i den delportfölj som i huvudsak stödjer våra interna förmågor inom ledning, styrning och verksamhetsstöd.
   

  

 Du kommer själv arbeta nära chefer på andra avdelningar för att skapa så bra förutsättningar som möjligt för dina medarbetare att leverera värde.
   

  

 Vår verksamhet är i ständig utveckling och förändring. Vi har en gemensam syn på hur ledarskapet bidrar till det, hur vi når resultat och främjar en förändringskultur. Som chef och ledare hos oss är du med och driver utveckling av både verksamhet och ledarskap. Det är en självklarhet för oss att du ska ha balans mellan arbete och fritid.
   

  

 Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas. Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss .
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha förmåga att se helheten med fokus på kundvärde
* ha förmåga att skapa rätt förutsättningar utifrån din förståelse för verksamhet och uppdrag
* ha förmåga att agera medvetet i vardagen utifrån en god självinsikt
* kunna hantera och analysera informationsflöden, se samband, avgränsa och förmedla information
* ha förmåga att kommunicera tydligt och skapa ett klimat där vi lyssnar på varandra


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* en akademisk utbildning inom it/datavetenskap eller annan utbildning i kombination med arbetslivserfarenhet som vi bedömer som relevant för befattningen
* flerårig aktuell och relevant chefserfarenhet inom It
* relevant erfarenhet av att driva verksamhetsutveckling och förändringsledning inom It
* relevant erfarenhet av och ansvar för inköpta system, både cloud och on-premises baserade
* relevant erfarenhet av att rekrytera såväl som att avropa konsulter


 Det är önskvärt att du har arbetslivserfarenhet av att den utveckling du ansvarar för använder SAFe som ramverk. Erfarenhet och intresse för it-säkerhet är önskvärt.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader. Inom Skatteverket tillämpar vi chefsförordnanden på upp till fem år, med möjlighet till förlängning i perioder om högst tre år, utan begränsning i antal förlängningar.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, vår syn på ledarskap och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/779 | Kontakt: Per Landman, enhetschef per.landman@skatteverket.se, Frida Hörnquist, rekryterare frida.hornquist@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Therese Sjödin, Seko therese.sjodin@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-10-02 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-10-23

title: Director of Innovation & Technology
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**With a passion for life**
 Join our diverse teams of passionate people and a career that allows you to develop both personally and professionally. At Getinge we exist to make life-saving technology accessible for more people. To make a true difference for our customers – and to save more lives, we need team players, forward thinkers, and game changers.
   

  

 Are you looking for an inspiring career? You just found it.
   

  

 Are you our new Director of Innovation & Technology at Getinge Critical Care in Solna? At Critical Care we develop tomorrow’s intensive care products and equipment, and we are in an intensive period of change and expansion. In this role you will be a key player within our R&D organization and have the possibility to take an active part in shaping our future products. The Innovation & Technology team has deep knowledge in our products, legacy and work together with external partners like hospitals and tech-companys to create the solutions for tomorrow always keeping the customer need in focus.
   

  

 The position offers you a great opportunity to be part of the R&D management team and influence how we prioritize and drive our Innovation, Product Development and Sustaining.
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 In this position you will be responsible for securing that we have the right setup to drive innovation with deep technical expertise, rapid prototyping, usability and concept development. Today, the team consists of about 12 highly experienced engineers with a broad expertise in the technology and clinical applications of Ventilation, Anaesthesia, Data Analysis, Simulation, prototyping with mechatronics etc. The R&D organization within Critical Care currently consists of 250 dedicated employees in Sweden and Germany.
   

  

 The position gives you the opportunity to join a winning team, helping to continue the growth of our market leading and life saving products. You will interface with a wide variety of stakeholders on all levels.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities And Tasks Will Be**
* As a member of the R&D management team, participate in the portfolio discussions and drive the Innovation funnel
* Implement continuous improvement through new ways of working, and when needed apply Change Management
* Drive partnerships with Universities, Hospitals, Tech-partners and relevant Institutes world-wide
* Develop team competences and drive the strategy of Innovation forward to secure Getinge’s future competitiveness
* Daring to dream and feel comfortable being Visionary, but keep your feet on the ground


 The position is based at our site in Solna but offers the flexibility to work from home when suitable, though not more than 1-2 days per week. The role requires occasional international travel. You will be reporting to the Head of R&D in Critical Care.
   

  

**You will bring**
 To fit in this role, we believe that you have the following experience:
   

  

* PhD or MSc within Engineering or relevant field
* Excellent leadership skills, and experience from leading a cross-functional team for integrated technology development
* Experience from Concept development with rapid prototyping, speed design reviews, customer workflows and UX validation
* Experience from leading a team where you are more the facilitator than the expert, they are the experts
* Experience from implementation of TRL (Technology Readiness Levels) will be useful
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.
* Experience of working in a regulated industry and especially development of medical device
* A proven track-record of cross-company collaboration aligning expectations and stake holder management


 To succeed in this position, you need to be a strong and business oriented leader who is able to self drive, inspire others and set direction, priorities and goals. To work with Critical Care products means to work in a complex and fast changing environment, hence you are a change driver who creates results by successful implementation of new ways of working in a fast-paced environment. We believe that you are inspired by leading and motivating others, making continuous improvements and that you see this as an exciting opportunity to contribute to the success of our product development. Additionally, communication, influencing and stakeholder management skills are highly important.
   

  

**Application**
 Applications will be reviewed continually, and we therefore recommend sending us your application as soon as possible. We kindly ask you to submit your application in our recruitment system by clicking the “apply now” button. Due to GDPR regulations we do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

 For this position we will conduct a background check on the final candidate.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Hiring Manager Magnus Tunklev at magnus.tunklev@getinge.com or Recruiter Emma Paulsson at emma.paulsson@getinge.com .
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**About Us**
 With a firm belief that every person and community should have access to the best possible care, Getinge provides hospitals and life science institutions with products and solutions aiming to improve clinical results and optimize workflows. The offering includes products and solutions for intensive care, cardiovascular procedures, operating rooms, sterile reprocessing and life science. Getinge employs over 12,000 people worldwide and the products are sold in more than 135 countries.

title: CISO
description:
Vill du vara med och påverka arbetet med informations- och cybersäkerhet i ett expansivt och framgångsrikt bolag med en stark företagskultur? Motiveras du av att ha en nyckelroll med strategiskt ansvar, där du driver utvecklingen av struktur, regelefterlevnad och riskhantering inom säkerhetsområdet? Då kan vi på Svedea ha rätt utmaning för dig!
   

  

 Vi söker nu en CISO, Chief Information Security Officer som vill bidra med både expertis och affärsförståelse!
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 I rollen som CISO har du ansvar för att utforma strategi och struktur för arbetet inom informations - och cybersäkerhet. Du leder och organiserar arbetet och rapporterar till styrelse och ledning.
   

  

 En viktig uppgift är att säkerställa efterlevnad av relevanta regelverk såsom DORA och GDPR och att hålla dig uppdaterad på information om nya hot, regelverk, standarder och teknologisk utveckling inom området.
   

  

 Du har ansvar för framtagande av aktuella styrdokument och leder arbetet med utformning och uppdatering av dessa.
   

  

 Rollen utgör en oberoende kontrollfunktion för identifiering och hantering av risker som rör informations- och cybersäkerhet, vilket innebär att du bedömer, analyserar och rapporterar risker till ledning och styrelse samt utvärderar och följer upp fastställda informationssäkerhetsmål.
   

  

 Tjänsten ingår i CFO-funktionen, du har god förståelse för affärsverksamheten och har ett nära samarbete med olika delar av verksamheten såsom IT, Legal med flera.
   

  

 Som expert stödjer du verksamheten genom att utbilda, skapa insikter och medvetenhet och deltar även i externa branschforum och andra samarbetsmöten.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 På Svedea lägger vi stor vikt vid personlighet och potential. Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* akademisk examen inom datavetenskap, IT, Informationssäkerhet eller motsvarande.
* djup teknisk expertis inom IT- och informationssäkerhet.
* minst fem års relevant erfarenhet av arbete med styrnings- och kontrollarbete inom IT-säkerhet, informationssäkerhet eller från andra närliggande områden. Du har din erfarenhet ovan från reglerad verksamhet, gärna från aktörer under FI:s tillsyn t. ex bank eller försäkring och är van vid att delta i arbetet med att utforma styrdokument och skapa struktur för kontrollarbete. Din erfarenhet sträcker sig över både strategiskt och operativt arbete inom relevanta områden.


 Det är meriterande om du tidigare haft ansvar för både analys, bedömning och hantering av risker. Erfarenhet från riskbedömning är viktigt och vi ser det som en fördel om du har arbetat med att vägleda och stödja verksamhet i regelverksfrågor inom området. Dessutom är det ett plus om du inom området har relevanta certifieringar.
   

  

*Personliga egenskaper*
 Du är en problemlösare som ser till helheten och prioriterar utifrån övergripande strategier. Tar snabbt in ny kunskap och använder din erfarenhet på ett flexibelt sätt.
   

  

 Du förstår verksamhetsstrategier och prioriteringar, tillämpar din kunskap om affärsdrivande faktorer i ditt arbete. Fokuserar energi och resurser på projekt och uppgifter som genererar ett mervärde.
   

  

 Du tar fram kort- och långsiktiga planer som är övergripande och realistiska. Integrerar kort- och långsiktiga mål med helhetsbilden.
   

  

 Du tvekar inte att anta utmaningar och förmedlar energi när du kommunicerar. Du har en god förmåga att påverka andras åsikter eller beteenden genom att tydligt ta ställning i olika frågor.
   

  

 För dig är det naturligt att ta kontakt med andra och att både bygga nya relationer och utveckla befintliga. Du skapar samarbete med andra och förhåller dig till andra på ett öppet och accepterande sätt som får andra att känna sig bekväma.
   

  

 Du är en skicklig kommunikatör som förmedlar information tydligt och enkelt, både muntligt och skriftligt. Du lyssnar effektivt, försöker förstå motparten innan hen lägger fram sina argument. Håller andra informerade; ger specifik och konstruktiv feedback.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* En arbetsplats som befinner sig i en spännande expansiv fas där dina tankar och idéer uppmuntras.
* En inspirerande företagskultur som kännetecknas av laganda med passionerade och engagerade kollegor som förstår vikten av att hjälpas åt och att ha kul tillsammans. Mer om vår kultur hittar du här!
* Ett riktigt schysst förmånspaket med b.la 5 000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag och möjlighet till en årlig bonus. Läs mer om våra förmåner här!
* Kontor högst upp i ett av Kungsholmens häftigaste hus med 360 graders vy över stan och terrasser i flera väderstreck. Spana in vår Office tour här - Office tour Stockholm


**Låter det intressant?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan! I den här rekryteringen samarbetar vi med Qsearch vilket innebär att du skickar in ditt CV till dem via ansökningslänken. Vi arbetar löpande med urval så vänta inte utan skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Har du frågor om tjänsten eller processen är du välkommen att kontakta Helena Pettersson via mejl helena.pettersson@qsearch.se eller telefon: 070-593 87 66.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Om Svedea**
 Svedea är en framgångssaga. Våra första 15 år har gjort oss till det ledande bolaget inom försäkring av fritidsfordon som motorcykel, båt och snöskoter och vi är en stark utmanare inom bil-, djur- och företagsförsäkring. Efter önskemål från våra kunder erbjuder vi nu även hem- och villaförsäkring. Idag har vi omkring 430 000 kunder och fortsätter att växa snabbt.
   

  

 Vår vision är att förändra försäkringsbranschen genom att finnas tillgängliga och göra allt för våra kunder. Hemligheten bakom vår framgång är engagerade medarbetare som trivs p-å jobbet i kombination med en tydlig företagskultur. Nu ökar vi tempot för att fortsätta växa, behålla de mest engagerade medarbetarna och de nöjdaste kunderna\*. Vår resa har bara börjat!
   

  

* Svenskt Kvalitetsindex (SKI) har tilldelat Svedea utmärkelsen Sveriges nöjdaste kunder i kategorin fordonsförsäkringar 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023 och 2024 samt i kategorin djurförsäkring 2023. Vi är även stolta vinnare av SKI för båtförsäkring 2025.

title: Data Analyst (FTC)
description:
**About MAG (in brief!)**
 At MAG Interactive we make word and trivia mobile games that feel good. As a part of this fun and dynamic industry, it’s our mission to spread joy to players around the world. With over 350 million downloads globally, we credit our success to our awesome colleagues and we hope you'll join the team!
   

  

**The role - Data Analyst**
 (Fixed term contract until August 2027)
   

  

 You will help us to continue to make best use of the huge amount of player data we have, to improve our games and to help our teams make better decisions. With more than 2 million data points collected every minute, there’s a vast amount of data to play with!
   

  

 This is a really impactful role here and through your careful data analysis you will help to shape our games!
   

  

 You will be responsible for maintaining, designing and implementing data pipelines and dashboards for our games. You will build strong relationships with the product teams and our game designers where you will delve into the data to help them to understand the players, while also helping to provide insights to impact the game and its economy.
   

  

 You will also conduct research into how we can leverage our rich data collection to add value to the business as a whole.
   

  

**The team**
 The team is currently made up of 6 team members, a mix of data engineers and data analysts.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
* Collaborate with product teams to set up in-game tracking, identify tracking issues and leverage tracking data analytics to provide insights.
* Act as the liaison between product, game developers and data engineers to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
* Work together with key stakeholders and the game teams to optimize game economy, evaluate game performance and offer suggestions accordingly.
* Work with the game teams to provide insight into player behaviour using data collected from users and games to answer key business questions.
* Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics and players’ experience.
* Use DBT (Data Build Tool) to design, document, and maintain scalable data models that power dashboards and reporting.
* Identify errors and solve issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics related to retention, monetization and user acquisition.
* Ensure we continue to collect and document appropriate data.
* Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis to identify strategies to improve engagement, retention and monetization.
* Manage multiple projects at a time in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.


**Your Skills/experience**
* Bachelor degree or Masters within Engineering, Mathematics or similar.
* Excellent SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets. You would consider SQL to be your bread and butter!
* Experience delivering clean, accurate and understandable data reports, visualization and dashboards.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to present findings confidently to cross-functional teams.
* Prior experience performing quantitative analysis.
* High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail.
* You are curious and driven to discover the underlying explanations of things!


**Nice to have (but not essential!)**
* Proficiency in relevant scripting language(s), e.g. Python, R
* Familiarity with DBT (Data Build Tool) is a plus.
* You have experience with visualisation tools such as; Tableau, Looker or PowerBI (we use Tableau).
* True passion for understanding users' social gaming behavior
* An understanding of mobile game/app KPIs and the rationale and calculation behind them


**Perks And Benefits**
* Generous company bonus
* Company mobile phone and contract
* Favorable pension and private health insurance package
* Flexible work hours
* Seasonal kick-offs
* Gym allowance
* Generous learning and development budget
* Monthly After works
* Enhanced parental leave
* Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives
* Free Beginner Swedish lessons (if you wish to learn the language!)


**At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!**
**Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.**
**About MAG**
 We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.
   

  

 We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.
   

  

 Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.

title: Web Analyst (Nordics)
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights that drive digital growth? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where customer experience is at the heart of everything? We’re looking for a Web Analyst to join our Nordics E-commerce team in Region North Europe.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a Web Analyst, you’ll play a key role in optimizing the customer journey on hm.com and the H&M app for our Nordic markets (SE, NO, DK, FI). Your insights will directly influence how we shape the digital experience, ensuring that we meet our customers’ needs and drive digital growth.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Analyse customer behaviour and site performance to identify opportunities that enhance the digital experience and drive sales.
* Follow up on strategies and actions, delivering actionable insights to the Digital team and cross-functional teams.
* Conduct full-funnel analysis, including traffic and internal search, to understand and improve the customer journey.
* Evaluate landing pages, traffic channels, and customer segments to optimize performance.
* Take lead in developing, implementing and setting best practice for new analytics tools and platforms to facilitate a data-driven way of working.


**Who You’ll Work With**
 Join a collaborative Digital team, reporting to the E-commerce Commercial Manager for Nordics. You will work close with the Experience Lead and with E-commerce Leads, and partner with Regional Digital Controllers and cross-functional teams to unlock growth and profitability. You will also be a part of our global Web Analyst community.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 We are looking for people with…
   

  

* A university degree in Business, Economics, Data Science, or a related field
* 3+ years of experience in web and data analytics, ideally within a fast-paced e-commerce or digital retail environment.
* Strong business acumen with a proven track record of translating data into strategic actions that drive growth and customer experience improvements.
* Advanced proficiency in Power BI, Looker Studio, GCP, Excel and other relevant data visualization tools (e.g. Content Square) with beneficial experience in programming languages such as Big query, SQL, R, or Python as well as A/B testing experience.


 And people who are…
   

  

* Analytical thinkers with a strong commercial acumen, able to connect customer behaviour insights to business goals and influence decision-making across teams.
* Team-players who thrive in cross-functional environments, communicate clearly, and are passionate about driving growth and continuous improvement through data.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* 30 days holiday
* We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* Benify Benefits Portal
* Community with activities


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

 This is a full-time, permanent position based in Stockholm, with start date no later than January 31. Please send in your application as soon as possible. Simply attach your resume in English– no need for a cover letter.
   

  

 We don't offer any relocation assistance for this role.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Systemingenjörer (Hårdvara) x 3
description:
**Professional Galaxy** 
 söker ett flertal Systemingenjörer (svensktalande) enligt följande beskrivningen till en kund i Helsingborg. Där det finns behov av en (1) konsult som är mer specialiserad inom
 **cybersäkerhet** 
 , en (1) inom
 **kravhantering** 
 och en (1) inom
 **arkitektur** 
 .
   

  

 Som Systemingenjör hos vår kund har du en viktig roll i att omvandla tekniska koncept till innovativa och hållbara lösningar. Du kommer att tillhöra Solutionsteamet, där vi utvecklar och levererar kompletta IT-lösningar, skräddarsydda efter kundens behov och specifikationer. Vi förverkligar deras IT-vision genom att erbjuda robusta och pålitliga infrastrukturlösningar.
   

  

 I din roll arbetar du i projektgrupper genom hela projektets livscykel, från idé till färdig lösning och i nära samarbete med både interna team och externa kunder. Som systemingenjör är det du som realiserar systemarkitekturen för att säkerställa att alla systemkomponenter fungerar i komplexa systemstrukturer och krävande miljöer.
   

  

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**
* Utforma och utveckla systemarkitektur på flera nivåer för att säkerställa skalbara och robusta lösningar, med fokus på IT-hårdvara
* Rekommendera och implementera tekniska lösningar för både interna och externa kunder
* Utarbeta projektmodeller, styrande dokument, systembeskrivningar och annan viktig dokumentation som stödjer utvecklingsarbetet
* Fånga upp och dokumentera krav, samt etablera och hantera kravbaser.
* Arbeta brett med varierande uppgifter, från kravanalys och teknisk specifikation till kunddialog och dokumentationsgranskning
* Stödja interna team i utvecklingen av både hårdvara och mjukvara för att säkerställa att systemen lever upp till krav och förväntningar
* Underhålla och vidareutveckla företagets ramverk för Systems Engineering och bidra till en kultur av kontinuerlig innovation


**Det här bidrar du med**
* Erfarenhet som systemingenjör med kunskap inom kravhantering och systemlivscykelprocesser (exempelvis enligt INCOSE, ISO/IEC/IEEE 15288)
* Utbildning inom datavetenskap, teknikutbildning, mekatronik, elektronikingenjör eller systemutveckling med fokus på hårdvara. Alternativt motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet, exempelvis driftsättning av maskiner eller IT-infrastruktur/nätverk
* Erfarenhet av kundkontakt samt vana att arbeta i projekt och projektteam
* Du är en lagspelare som är nyfiken, drivande och affärsorienterad med fokus på innovation
* Kunskap inom nätverk och IT är meriterande
* Kunskap inom cybersäkerhet är meriterande
* Vana vid modellering eller scriptning (t.ex. Python eller PowerShell) ses som ett plus
* God kommunikativ förmåga i både svenska och engelska


 Du måste vara svensk medborgare då tjänsten är säkerhetsklassad. Det genomförs såväl bakgrundskontroller som drogtest innan uppdragsstart.
   

  

 Skriv gärna kort motivering om hur du uppfyller alla krav!
   

  

**Uppdrags längd:** 
 2025-11-10 till 2026-04-30

title: Copywriter
description:
